Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Boston1964
Reviews.Content: My wife and I brought our three kids to Montreal from Boston for the weekend and the Hilton Bonaventure worked perfectly as a base. I was impressed by how friendly the staff are - it looks like management has done a good job investing in training. The downtown location plus heated rooftop pool make this hotel a very attractive option. Parking is right below the building. Good restaurants like Norah Gray (without the kids) are close by, and you can easily walk to Old Montreal, McGill, or the main shopping areas. Desperate to feed the kids in a hurry ? Don't worry there is a Tim Hortons and a McDonalds right across the street. What makes this hotel memorable for me are the high quality staff and the interesting setting - the hotel is built on top of a 1970s skyscraper. Relax by the pool and enjoy a unique view of the Montreal skyline - you are already halfway up.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 5”
Reviews.Author: Grandma R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently on an overnight trip to take in a concert. The location is perfect if you take the train in, as we did, as it is just across the street from Central Station. It is quicker to go across the street at ground level although underground access is also available, but more circuitous. The desk staff was very helpful, even walking us over to the elevator between the half-floors ( reception is on a level halfway between the 2 floors of the hotel) as one of us has mobility issues. As a place built in the 1960's (?), it is not as handicapped-friendly as we would want these days - the pool is definitely not very accessible as you have to go up many steps to get to the entrance. The locker rooms are large and airy, but have small (an inch or two) level changes which can trip you up if you are not looking; the attendants are very helpful and fully bilingual - we speak both official languages but it is comforting to know that the staff switch between them depending on how they interpret your accent. The pool itself is small but nice and warm on a cold April day - if you float on your back, your body will be warm but your tootsies will be cool. The room itself was large and well furnished - the listing did not specify that it had a mini-fridge but there was one - a great place to store your doggie bag from Dunn's - a few blocks away and a must when you visit Montreal. Everything else was there - clock radio, Internet access, coffee maker (although the coffee provided was only so-so; it was also in a bag, like tea, so don't bring your own coffee as there is no filter cone), iron and board, etc. The 'Serenity Bath collection to pamper yourself after a long day' is a tad overstated as it consists of the usual - no bubble bath or bath gel, only a bar; run of the mill shampoo and conditioner; hand cream; shower cap (does anyone actually use these); and bar of face soap. The ice bucket was good as it was double walled and stayed cold long enough to cool down the gel ice packs my husband uses every day for his back pain - a freezer in the fridge would have been better, but mini-fridges are not usually big enough for this. The safe in the room was a nice surprise and we used it whenever we left the room. The alarm clock hadn't been adjusted for daylight saving time and there were no instructions on it to adjust the time - both my husband and myself tried to wing it and failed - good thing our cell phones have alarms. It plays from your MP3 but doesn't charge it so bring your own charger. We had a garden view which was fabulous; it was too early for the plants to be blooming but the pond and waterfall were pretty - we saw some finches at the bird feeder and a gull eating a fish from the pond - sad but natural. The heating/cooling is adjustable in the room. but it was noisy when it kicked in - not so good when you are trying to sleep. All in all I would stay here again, but I would bring more of my own toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JoeinTO
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Hilton Hotel Bonaventure. From the outside, the hotel is a bit off-putting with it's 1960s brutilist architecture and the fact you have to enter an elevator lobby and ride up several stories to the main lobby. Once you get there however, the public spaces and rooms are lovely and look like they have been refurburshied in the last few years. My room was quite large with a marble bathroom and large desk for working. The staff were friendly and very efficient. You have the option of checking out without having to visit the front desk, they slip your invoice under the door the night before. Food at my event was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Location a plus with nice rooms”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights - it is a great location for all the transport links , Subway, Via Rail , Airport bus etc accessible through the network of underground walkways that are a feature of Montreal and great when it is wet and or cold. You would never choose this hotel if you saw it from the outside as it is part of a 60/70's grey architecture that has very little appeal. Interior of the Hotel has been brightened up by nice artwork and there is a warm outdoor pool around the interior courtyard that adds to it attractiveness. As I am a HHonours member I made use of the Executive Lounge which offerred very freindly service and nice evening snacks although you do have to pay for Alcohol through an honour system. Rooms are of a decent size and have Coffee Makers with nice Lavazza Coffee. Overall the staff were freindly and granted me a late check out when my flight was delayed. A nice hotel to stay in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms, slow restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Sylvene
Reviews.Content: Located central and downtown, the staff are efficient and friendly, the beds firm, plenty of pillows and extra blankets in the room, big, heavy bath robe provided as well as coffee, creamers and tea bags with the coffee maker. The room cleaning could have been better as it was obvious that it wasn't vacuumed everyday. I left a bit of lint from my new socks on the carpet that remained for two days. The hotel does have a heated outdoor pool which I unfortunately did not have the time to appreciate. The restaurant - Service was excruciatingly slow. The fries were very well done and the steak sandwich perfect the first day but the second, I was surprised that the waiter dared serve it. It was obviously burnt - and one bite showed the steak over done as well. I sent it back and got a better sandwich but as I was there for a conference, I really don't have the time to linger over lunch. The chef also has a very heavy hand with the salt - so ask for low salt on everything. A pity that cannot be done with the soup. The hotel however, is connected to the underground, and there are breakfast places as well as a food court for quick bites.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with a strange layout”
Reviews.Author: Mysticyat
Reviews.Content: This property is well located for business in central Montreal, but a $10 taxi ride to Old Montreal and it's restaurants/attractions. The hotel is located on the top floor of a commercial building, so you enter on the ground floor and then elevator up to the Lobby and room access. Be advised if you have any mobility issues, this IS NOT the hotel for you. ALL of the sleeping rooms are either up or down a set of 8 shallow stairs with no guest elevator access. The rooms were very conventional business hotel rooms in layout and amenities. I liked the bed, which was very soft, but not everyone likes a very soft mattress. Lobby restaurant and bar were nice with a good, relaxed vibe - breakfast restaurant was outrageously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: cafegrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Montreal Bonaventure in February of 2012 for a work-related conference. This hotel is laid out somewhat oddly, with the lobby itself being several floors up and the hotel rooms only occupying a few floors. I had a city view that was nothing impressive. The hotel has an outdoor, rooftop pool that looked great â€“ but you can see it from the lobby, making it not a great place to go and swim when you're here with a bunch of people that you work with. There were two minor things that bothered me during my stay at this Hilton. When the hotel was busy you often had to wait in line to get down via the elevator to the ground floor. The service at the bar and restaurant at the hotel during lunch was exceedingly slow, even after we had told the waitstaff that we had a meeting to get to. While I didn't have a room in the executive floor, everyone raved about the executive lounge and the breakfast there. Wi-fi internet access was slow at times and I often had calls dropped when I was on Skype with my family when calling from the room. Overall, an average hotel, I'm sure there are better in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Oasis”
Reviews.Author: DashYul
Reviews.Content: Comfortable large rooms in the middle of the city. Open the window and what would you expect to see? A DUCK!! A planted woodland with a stream and duck pond set the tone for a relaxing stay. The roof top (30TH) outdoor pool is amazing in the winter. Up grade for the lounge alone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for MontrÃ©al exploration”
Reviews.Author: Andrei Z
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hilton MontrÃ©al Bonaventure at least once a year, usually for business. It has always been a great experience due to its spacious and modern rooms, great conference facilities, attentive service, and rooftop pool. Yes, the rooftop pool is enough to give it an extra star â€”Â especially in the winter, when you can go swimming with sub-zero temperatures outside and pretend you're in Blue Lagoon with all the steam coming off the water. This last time, I had Hilton Gold membership and got upgraded to a bigger room and had access to the executive lounge. The breakfast served there was great and made more fantastic by the lounge manager Guy. The hotel is situation across from a bus station and a train station, which you can easily reach underground (in the winter). It's a great base for exploring MontrÃ©al and I recommend staying here if you're visiting for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: wcottawa
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel fairly last minute via the montreal tourisme website. This meant we paid full price for the first night and got the second night for half (the sweet winter deal). After checking everything on line, for the extra $ we upgraded to the executive level package-well worth it. First off-we find the Hilton staff the best of any hotel chains we have experienced and this time was no different. From the moment we arrived until the final "have a safe trip" from the doorman it was a totally great experience. We travelled by Via rail and arrived before noon on Friday and left on Sunday at 4 pm. We checked via phone and the Hilton would store our luggage on arrival & departure (Hilton is right across the street from the train station) but it was suggested we check if our room was ready on arrival (12 pm). It was, so we could check in, use the facilities, etc. Also we requested a late checkout on Sunday and that happened as well without extra charge-maybe/probably because of the upgrade to executive. We feel the $50+/night more than compensated. Executive upgrade included a really great "continental" breakfast which included at least 3 hot dishes (over 2 days we had scrambled eggs, homefries, french toast, pancakes, sausages) as well as top of the line breads, bagels and pastries, fruit, cereals, excellent cheeses and cold cuts and an awesome selection of juices, milk, coffee, tea, expresso, cappucino, etc. (We paid $24 each for a sunday breakfast at the Marriott in Niagara Falls in February and this was actually a better option because of the specialty coffee available.) Also on offer with the executive upgrade was the all day beverages options-including juice, soft drinks, hot beverages and the specialty coffees and teas + 5-7 h'or doevres -beer and wine available but extra and a dessert selection from 7 to 9. We ate a great lunch on Friday and didn't go out for dinner...cheese, crackers, a couple of hot selections (quiche, puff pastry, polenta with proscuitto) a different pasta each night, a couple of vegetable options (gazpacho with raw vegetables, greek feta salad-tapas style, etc.) All staff were very friendly and everyone spoke french/english and other languages! We look forward to going back! The roof top swimming pool is so awesome! There were lots of families (we are a middle aged couple) but there were lots of extended families from parents with tots and teens and lots of families with grandparents. The rooftop is beautiful and I can imagine in summer it is a topnotch place (there is a sweet deal in the summer but we will have to see if Hilton Bonadventure is a part of that (first 2 nights full price, 3rd night half price). And even dogs-not in the pool, in the hotel. We loved our stay and the winter swimming and executive lounge topped off the experience, suggestions by the concierge for dinner were spot on also (see later review...) Staff were awesome-can't remember them all but 3 at front desk, Guy in BonAdventure Executive Room and Louis at Concierge were memorable. Would definitely do this again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Danthemannad
Reviews.Content: Was participating at a business convention in Montreal. We stayed at this hotel. Nice hotel with comfortable beds and nice view of downtown Montreal. Near Place Bonaventure. Closed to Bell centre and all fancy restaurant around.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, probably over priced”
Reviews.Author: sjskier63
Reviews.Content: The food is excellent. The staff are very professional, if not super warm. Rooms are comfortable, well appointed and clean. Good gym, esp. for a hotel. Small note: I loved the shade garden mini-atrium in the hallway. On the minus side, carpeting is hideous. I had carpet stains in my room of suspicious origin. WiFi is annoying (difficult sign in process, and have to re-do process daily) and doesn't work in gym (this is imp. if you are not Canadian as you begin very expensive roaming when wifi goes away). The thermostat in my room seemed to have little effect on temp and i was a bit chilly. These are not what I expect for a "4 diamond" $200/night hotel. Overall a very nice place, but for the money I expected bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BMurf
Reviews.Content: The location was centrally located to all the city activities. The hotel was within walking distance of Bell Centre, St. Catherine Street and the underground city shops. It was interesting going up the elevator to get to the lobby, which was a unique experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean but it still looked like it needed some completion of renovation but it was nothing that affected my overall stay. I plan on additional trips to Montreal and I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quaility in every way”
Reviews.Author: TomL_Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: Zero disapointmeents. A great example of a modern well run urban hotel. The rooftop pool is simlpy great. At the top of the list when it comes to Hilton's. Would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I may return...”
Reviews.Author: kcdy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Family Day long weekend with my partner while we spent time downtown Montreal. If it was possible I would give this hotel a rating of 3.5, because it is better than average, but I wouldn't go as far to say it was great - but good enough. Overall it severed it's purpose as place to sleep at night, and the staff were all accomdating. The things I disliked about the place were: 1) The elevators up to the lobby were usually crowded (there are only two, and usually there were atleast a dozen people at any givin time waiting to go up or down, plus luggage and bags etc.; 2) The King size bed was not as comfortable as I had hoped for, and the room seemed a little dark; 3) Everytime the tank on the back of the toilet would refill after we flushed, it would make a loud noise and the whole toilet would shake back and fourth hitting the wall behind it. The first time it happened, we were afraid it might actually break free it was shaking so hard. They are small things that didn't ruin our stay, but prevented me from giving the hotel a higher rating. The good: 1) We arrived at the hotel at 11:45 a.m., despite check-in not starting until later in the afternoon, they were able to accomidate us, and let us check in early. Being tired from a very early morning flight, I really appreciated that. 2) In the evening we wanted to go for a casual, but nice dinner. We didn't want to go to any chain restaurants, or spend a fortune on swanky fine dining, but we didn't know where to go. We asked the concierge, Chantal, who recommended a place, gave us directions and the address. We had such a wonderful meal, we were talking about it all weekend. 3) The location is very convienient, as it's connected to the main metro line (orange line), just accross from the train station, the 747 express bus from the airport stops 1 block north, and it is walking distance to St. Catherine St, and Old Montreal. 4) We had a late departure flight, and were grateful that we could store our bags at the hotel after checking out, instead of lugging them all over the city all day. I did notice there were a number of steps going up and down throughout the hallways, so if you have mobility issues, this hotel probably isn't the best choice. There was some confrences happening on the Friday when we arrived, because it seemed busy and there were lots of groups of people walking around with name tags on, but we still felt well taken care of. I am not against going back, but there are so many hotels in Montreal, I may decide check out a new place next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Well done!”
Reviews.Author: Tripfantastic
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It's all on two floors on the top of an office building. The elevator only has two buttons. I really liked not having to deal with the elevator as I went back and forth from my meeting to my room. The outdoor pool and the gardens looked amazing. I had a city view and the windows had noise-proof glass. The room service breakfast was fast and affordable. The staff was very available and helpful. A big shout out to all three concierges (Julien, Chantal, and Maxime) who were extremely informative, even before I arrived. I would definitely stay at this hotel if I am lucky enough to visit Montreal again. Loved the fact I could walk to coffee shops and central train station without going outdoors, although the weather was quite mild.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: zyllom
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel for several days for a conference and I would recommend it highly for both business and pleasure travelers alike. The layout of the hotel is initially a bit disorienting because it seems to be a "penthouse" hotel, meaning it is restricted to the top floor of a building. As you enter the ground floor, you are directed to an elevator and whisked to the top floor where you check-in. You might think this would make for fabulous views of the city, but it does not -- the top floor of the building is "landscaped" to look as if you are on a ground floor; thus, the disorientation. Despite this, however, the hotel is quite lovely -- modern decor, friendly and efficient staff, excellent restaurant choices, great conference accommodations. If you are looking for more affordable food options, the hotel is located on an underground stop and you can find delicious cafe-like restaurants for breakfast and lunch there. The hotel is located in what seems to be a financial district and there are several nice restaurants within easy, safe walking distance. Walk a bit further and you will be surely charmed by Montreal's Old Town: Fantastic brunch, crepes, and souvenir shopping. The people of Montreal are absolutely lovely -- they speak French but kindly switch to English if necessary without condescension. I plan to go back in the summer for a proper vacation and would happily stay at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot believe lack of handicapped services”
Reviews.Author: Carmen A
Reviews.Content: I attended a scientific conference in Feb. of 2012. Mercifully I stayed at the nearby Marriott - nicer and better laid out. To get to the conference rooms we had to go up/down a fast moving escalator. The only elevator was the kitchen's (freight), so I had to go through the kitchen and a restaurant every time I needed to access the conference rooms. On one occasion, because of a private function, I was forced to use another restaurant to egress and go up and down some steps, despite being dependent on a walker for mobility. A friend took the walker up and down the steps and I almost fell. The employee who redirected us to the other restaurant saw no problem in my having to use steps and was dismissive of my concerns, almost offensive. Also, because the hotel reception is atop the building, elevators must be used to leave the hotel. There were only two, and often a large crowd gathered in the narrow space where those are located. This is not only inconvenient, but unsafe situation. Most of the personnel were friendly and polite, but since steps must be taken to access private rooms as well, people unable to stand up or walk, lift suitcases a few steps, or use strollers, must definitely avoid this hotel. Dr. Carmen G. Armengol Boston Mass., USA

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, overall good value”
Reviews.Author: bwl8772
Reviews.Content: This is a 1-story hotel basically spread out over 1/2 a block or so. It's located fairly close to the old port, which is nice. They don't serve breakfast really.. but you can get access to the "executive lounge" where they DO serve breakfast... so a good idea is to go onto hilton.com and then buy the pre-pay package that includes the access to the executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra911
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms very clean downtown Montreal the subway is just acroos the street and the cn train station. Close to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: pauljames403
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in downtown Montreal with quick access to the underground shopping malls and Metro, Wierd layout with the hotel designed on only two floors, but situated on top of a 10-15 story office building. So, when you go in, you elevator up to the lobby. It is a nice hotel, rooms are well appointed, but it is a bit pricy. My stay found me over $200 per night and you are paying for being in dowtown Montreal. The hotel has restaurent, bar, fitness, business center, and pool. Overall, a nice place, good location, just a little weird

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: OntheMoveWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Montreal Bonnaventure is in a great location, with direct underground access to the Metro. I felt safe at all times.The staff at the Consierge desk are always very haelpful, and take the time to give detail directions with a map.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place - but...3 hours to check in?!?!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy045
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very special place. The pool and the water treatments around the hotel make you feel a million miles away from downtown Montreal and yet you are in the middle of all the action. The hotel is a bit funny with stairs all over and a second floor check in but I think they added sections over the years. The room was clean and the bed was very good. The food was average at best which was disappionting giving the fact it was a hilton I was exspecting much better. The only but was at the check in I was delayed for three hours bacuse the hotel allowed the people from the night before to have a late check out... Oh sure I was given several free drinks and food but after traveling the day I wanted to get my comfy pants on and decompress not sit in a singles bar and drink free drinks... Still I would stay here anytime and highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Mrspriss
Reviews.Content: Convenient parking garage under building, pay at kiosk when u check out. Pool not warm like a hot tub, would b nice in the summer. Very friendly helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here Many Times Can't Believe I Haven't Written a Review”
Reviews.Author: MissJetSetter88
Reviews.Content: What another great hotel!!!! The pool is so great because it's heated and in the dead of winter what is more fun then swimming while watching snowfall. MAGICAL! The Bonaventure has an underground tunnel to an underground mall right across the street. I love not going outside when it's negative 20 degrees. The rooms are fancy and comfortable. Always a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdl119
Reviews.Content: This is a nice business hotel in a great, central location (walking distance to the Bell Centre). They have a large selection of conference rooms for meetings. The guest rooms are typical Hilton quality. Bathrooms are clean, but somewhat dated. The Executive Lounge serves a modest continental breakfast, as well as afternoon snacks (they charge for drinks). The restaurant has a very nice breakfast buffet, but is not a good choice for dinner (see separate review). The outdoor heated pool is open year-round.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly and helpful staff, connected to the underground city and subway, rooftop pool. What else could you ask for. Stay here, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very different”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions. Any time I stay downtown i prefer this hotel. It is quite different becasue it is the Penthouse of a highrise. Hilton has done a great job on this hotel, very contemporary. The management at this hotel is strong, the staff is top notch, its clean and well maintained. I always also measure a hotel by air quality and its great here.They make you feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence has a name”
Reviews.Author: MichaelHM
Reviews.Content: We attended the wedding of our friends at this Hotel. The wedding was a non-traditional event due to the different cultures of the Bride and Groom. We arrived early but the front desk weas able to accommodate us without fuss and with excellent service. We found the Hotel easily as we are former Montrealers but even if we had come in as total strangers would have had no problem finding the Hotel. The structure is very welcoming with an interio courtyard pool which is reminiscent of a resort within the City. This was our first time at this location and after the excellent service and the roomy facility it will not be our last. The location is very close to the Queen Elizabeth train station and boasts several floors at the top of the Place Bonaventure which means that there are innumerable places within a short stroll for Dining while the subway system is just an elevator ride away allowing access to the very large Montreal subway system for shopping and sightseeing within the city and its very lovely feel. The Hotel is very comfortable and it is very professionally run as it should being a Hilton. We found our room to be large, clean and meeting every expectation. This is a very nice venue for a weekend getaway for a couple of also for a family. Exceptional, try it. The prices are as expected in line with the style of this chain and the meals at the restaurants that we tried were well within expectations though there are tons of restaurants within a short stroll from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical downtown Hilton”
Reviews.Author: WJN58
Reviews.Content: Bonaventure has been our favourite hotel when staying in Montreal. Convenient location - 5 min walk to the main commercial area, 10 min walk to Old Montreal. Hotel is located on top of an office building with rooftop setting of a forest and a stream, the latter sometimes used by wild ducks. Heated open air pool is available as well. Ask for an inside room which gives you the view of the "nature" as opposed of surrounding office buildings which can be seen from outside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable, pleasant service too”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: We loved the outdoor pool. There was something magical about swimming outside with snow falling all around us. The staff was amazing, the bed very comfortable, and the windows do open a crack so fresh air is available when you want it. My only complaint was the plumbing; it's very, very old. The bathrooms, like the bedrooms, are refurbished and look great, but the building's age is apparent when you flush the toilet or turn on the hot water in the shower (hint: turn on the hot water, then do something else, like shave or make coffee, while you wait.) However despite this hiccup I'll come here when I next visit Montreal -- you're right in the heart of downtown, walking distance to everything, so here's what I'll do next time: get the self-parking with no in/out privileges, because I paid for in/out privileges (only available with valet service ?!?!) and never used the car. I could have spent that extra $20 at the Eaton Centre! :) Seriously, at $20 per day for self-parking, and $30 valet parking, this is an expensive option.

Reviews.Title: “Very confusing to get around... Poor tourists!”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth_pierre
Reviews.Content: We rented a room after the Holidays to enjoy the rooftop pool to this property. But let me first go through our experience. We wanted to use the valet service (very expensive but less hassle). Drove around the building 3 times and finally gave up as we could not find a semblance of a main entrance. Finally used the stinky underground parking (also very expensive). Finding the actual lobby was difficult. There are no signs anywhere and we had to ask numerous times to actually get there. Service was ok but decor is a little tired. Got our room key and although the decor is fairly new in these small rooms, the room itself was dirty (dirty cotton swabs on bathroom floor, filthy counters, hairs under the sink, etc... Not what one expects from a 4 diamond property. Not much light in the room either (very dark). The trip to the pool was confusing (again) and difficult (poor tourists from outside of Canada... not designed for outsiders). The actual pool experience was good however. Swimming outside in the winter was terrific! Keeping in mind however, that unless you are swimming, you cannot wait poolside as the tiny little entrance to the pool was cramped and nowhere to put anything but in the lockers (again, surprising for this class of hotel). Locker room was neglected. Overall experience... not to be repeated. Many great hotels in Montreal that actually have the visitors best interest in mind. A few signs and some cleanliness would be inexpensive for the hotel and greatly improve the guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for central Montreal”
Reviews.Author: GarageBear
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in a building connected by the underground city, this hotel was a great place to stay. The building is a bit strange with the 70's exposed concrete and split level design - but fun in a quirky way. The hotel was quiet except for Friday night when they had a bunch of parties including bagpipes in one of the rooms on my hallway. I guess I should have been out on the town instead of trying to sleep to catch my early flight the next morning. The staff was helpful and breakfast was included in my rate and a decent fare.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ordinary Hilton but quite nice!”
Reviews.Author: SamprasCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in October for two nights. Got upgraded to the executive floor as per the front desk agent. So what do I get for staying in the executive floor, I asked the agent. Free breakfast and a nice view. I opened the door of my room, thought it was more spacious but it was quite small, perhaps I was expecting too much. However, the view was nice. There was no building obstructing the view of my room. I could almost see the Casino from my room. Overall, the room was clean and the hotel is located in a good location. Good location meaning you are not far from downtown at all. Five minutes walking distance to Ste-Catherine street, ten minutes to Vieux-port (Old Montreal) and minutes away to other hotels if you don't like this one. The food was not too bad either but I wish they could have more varieties of food in the executive lounge during breakfast time. It was nice to relax though in the lounge, free internet, drinks, and newspaper. Unfortunately, I didn't have the chance to use the outdoor heated pool. If I stay there again, I will definitely jump in next time!

Reviews.Title: “weird but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arkadiy
Reviews.Content: So this is intersting hotel. Takes top 2 floors of tall building. I did not have time to enjoy all their amenities + a bit too cold in December for all their in city resort stuff. While room was nice, i found that this setup of having hotel being 2 top floors of tall building very inconvenient. It just takes more time to get from parking to hotel itself, more time to get to your room because the single floor is very big and you keep going through several corridors. Service was good. So in nutshell, while i cant say the hotel was terrible, i am not sure if it will be my first choice if i stay in Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but very good”
Reviews.Author: SaqibQ
Reviews.Content: I liked 1) the interior ambience which is soft, quiet and up to date 2) location, being in the city centre and next to the rail station 3) nice cozy feel which is unusual for a Hilton (the hotel only has two floors). I didn't like 1) the difficulty staff had in smiling 2) the slightly confusing hotel layout Overall: I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael731979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton in Montreal for a conference this November. It was a solid hotel. Everything was above average in quality. The people there were nice and helpful. Our French is rusty, so it was nice that everyone working there spoke flawless English. The location is excellent. We parked our car in the garage and never took it out for the four days we were there. It is close to public transportation and walking distance to most of the cool sites of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Cmokotres C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! You can walk from hotel to Bonaventura place, Villa Marie place, shopping centre Eaton, the weather isn't important. Old town is 10 minutes walking distance and st.catherine street is 5 mins walking distance. Staff is very helpful and kind, room was clean and comfortable (just ask view to town, not garden). Also, if it is first time in Montreal, ask everything on the reception, they have maps and they will explain you how to get to your destination. Don't take breakfast, because it is too expensive in my opinion, you can get great lunch for 2 for the value of breakfast. If You use telephone, use callbox in the lobby (next to the souvenir shop where you can buy phone cards-long distance) because they will add you 1$ just for dialing number. If You need a taxi, ask doorman who will call it and it will be there in 2 mins. Fixed price to the airport is $38. Hope I will help to someone with this review. Have a nice stay in Montreal, I liked it so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and restaurant... Cleaning not so much”
Reviews.Author: RoadWearyAndWorn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 0 and 3 in tries. I stayed here a few years ago and the hall/room was pretty musty. I'm not sure if they were renovating, but there is definitely a difference in rooms from the last stay (for the better). This time I walk in the room and the entrance light reminded me of a 80s horror movie where it blinks on with a struggle. The halls are dated and drab. I go to the washroom and there was dried urine and hair on the toilet seat... ewwww... The front staff was quick to react and even sent someone to get my bags and give me a key to a new room. Turn around time from call to new room was less than 5 minutes. The second room, while same design was much nicer. I go to the washroom (hey, I really had to go!) and the blue cleaning fluid hadn't even been flushed, I was fine with that, but when I went to shower there was hair in the tub. Seriously? Let me be clear, the rooms are clean, the staff very accomodating and the second room was pretty nice, the bed was very comfortable. I don't know if cleaning staff is being cutback, or what, but there's an obvious issue, if it hadn't happened two rooms in a row, I wouldn't be writing this. I'm a business traveller and I've not seen this in 10 years of travel, and I'm not particularly picky beyond wanting a clean room. This is a real shame in that the Front staff and restaurant are great...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, I will give it that”
Reviews.Author: YOWLaw
Reviews.Content: This building does not have what you might call curb appeal. A concrete block that seems to go on for ever the Hilton sign is the only thing that distinguishes it from any other government building. You must take one of two elevators up to the reception area that is too cramped for a seamless check in and then the rest of the hotel is found on one or two floors. Be ready to carry your bags up stairs as this building is one of the least accessible I have ever been in. The room was clean but dated. There is no wifi in the room so you have to plug in (might have something to do with all that concrete). The newspaper came one day, but not the next. The television had a limited selection of channels and the pay per view options were laughable (not one of the "still in theatres" was actually still in theatres but all were on blu ray). The lobby bar is odd and very very expensive (scotch and a beer, $54). The conference facilities are old with poor lines of sight and acoustics. The public rest rooms are very dated and not up to current standards for accessibility. Oh, don't have a coat at the conference, $2.50 to hang it up. The convention staff was rude and interfered with conversations but one server actually asked me if I liked my lunch, which had never happened to me before. She stood out as great. My conference was in this hotel but I would have stayed across the street at the Queen Elizabeth for a much more hospitable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was quirky, but I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: JMB2003
Reviews.Content: This is a solid hotel in a wonderful city. I was confused the first 24 hours-what floor am I on? Why take an elevator just to get to the reception? Why do I not need an elevator to get to my room? Once I got it, I really enjoyed the hotel flow. Nicely appointed rooms, great executive room access, friendly staff. Self parking was affordable and safe for big city. Would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at the train station”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller100
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights in June on a business trip. The location is perfect for train travelers -- right beside the train station and right in downtown Montreal. It's within walking distance to Old Montreal, to the shopping area, and to China town. One really doesn't need a car to explore Montreal if you stay in this hotel. The unique thing about this hotel is that, even though you are on the 22nd floor, because of the trees and other plants planted on the roof top, you feel you are right in the middle of an oasis. The room and the service all meet or exceed 4-star hotel standards. The swimming pool is at the roof top without a cover, so if you don't like to swim while it rains, it might be a problem. But the environment is very nice. It's expensive, but I would stay there again if someone else is paying for it :-)

Reviews.Title: “weekend in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDoddie
Reviews.Content: Spent the week-end in Montreal and stayed at the hilton bonaventure, what a great hotel, it is close to downtown, walking distance to every where, and the Hotel, well it is great,

Reviews.Title: “Limited handicap accessibility”
Reviews.Author: Iris S
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at this hotel and I am struggling with a knee injury and I must use crutches to get around. Trying to attend sessions in this hotel or to access a guest room was very difficult and challenging. The escalator moves so quickly that I was unable to use it safely to go downstairs to where the sessions were. So my only other option was to walk several corridors out of the way, through the dishwashing area, in an elevator, through the kitchen, through the back of a private club and out into the main lobby. This is completely unacceptable! My injury/disability is temporary. Imagine someone with a permanent disability. The guest rooms are 6 steps up or 6 steps down...not wheelchair friendly. The Maitre d'hotel banquets did everything he could to assist me but even the wheelchair was less than acceptable. The wheels didn't work properly and it was a very small wheelchair so unless you were a size 6, you couldn't fit in the chair. They also didn't have ice paks available for any type of injury - just FYI - they are $5.00 at any drug store. The hotel is great for healthy young people, but if you have any type of mobility issues or walking difficulty or require a walker or wheelchair....you better stay elsewhere. I would like to have the GM's email address so I could write to him, but this venue will have to do. Louis-Robert Handfield if you are reading this....email me at hardonbrakes@gmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: reycraft
Reviews.Content: A very interesting roof top hotel with a heated outdoor pool right in the middle of it. Executive room is a must for the free breakfast and evening snacks and free non alcholic beverages. Restaurant is expensive but so is most of the restaurants in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good amenities and interesting layout”
Reviews.Author: Sgrayg
Reviews.Content: Very modern rooms and great location to the business part of town, and great location to the train station. Could do with my internal restaurant choices but the lobby level foodery certainly did the job

Reviews.Title: “An elegant place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: aduffy1234
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hilton Bonaventure for our recent stay in Montreal based on the glowing recommendation of a frequent flying family member. The downtown location proved to be a great starting point for our city explorations. The room was clean, well laid out, and comfortable. The staff was courteous and al spoke flawless English. One evening we decided to sample some local ice wine we had purchased, the hotel quickly brought us glasses, opened, and then served us our wine. The breakfast was delicious, and the selection at the bar was above average. The rooftop garden was beautiful, although we didnâ€™t have time to walk though it in its entirety. Over all I give this hotel my full recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the best hotels in North America”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world and stay in perhaps 50 hotels a year. Outside of Asia, there are virtually no truly great hotels. Therefore it is amazing to find this gem using the Hilton brand in Montreal. It is very unusual, in that it is on one floor at the top of an old convention center. But it works great. It has free wired wifi, and it is fast and responsive. It also has free wireless in the lobby area. The pool looks great (although I'll have to wait to next time to try it personally). It is a outdoor, heated year-around pool, but you enter it from a warm room adjacent to the pool and enter the main pool through a short rectangular tunnel. The buffets in the restaurant are great. It is also incredibly convenient to Montreal's financial center, with most institutions within 100 meters. They can be accessed through underground tunnels if the weather is bad. The rooms are fine. Only one complaint: the TV's carry a lot of channels including free HBO and Cinemax, but they are piping in analog to digital TV's. Why in this day and age do hotels show such carelessness? I was there in an off-season, so it was quite inexpensive, although I am sure prices go way up at other times of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel stayed for conference”
Reviews.Author: sherban
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an executive room which came with free wi-fi, access to the lounge for complimentary breakfast and wi-fi lounge. This location is convenient to many restaurants and this Hilton has a great heated pool which is outdoor on top of the roof...actually the whole hotel is on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel wih great Staff”
Reviews.Author: homebre973
Reviews.Content: I attend this hotel for a 5 day conference. I will preface my remarks by saying I did not take meals at the hotel because they were quite expensive, but the facilities ave very nice, the staff extremely helpful, and the rooms very nice with free internet, cable TV, etc. Since I was on business travel for a conference at this hotel, I did not worry about the cost of lodging, only the food. However, Montreal is not an inexpensive city, and neither was the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Great service”
Reviews.Author: hopelucy
Reviews.Content: Three of my friends and I stayed here for two nights this past month. The rooms were great- lots of space, very clean, comfortable beds and a great view of the city. We received a great deal on the hotel room and free breakfast because one of my friend's was a Hilton Honors member. Breakfast was delicious and there was a huge selection. Gym had all the necessary equipment and a bonus yoga room. Didn't get a chance to enjoy the heated outdoor pool but it looked good. I LOVED the outdoor garden and patio! Such a nice place to sit for a little while. Unfortunately no wifi in the rooms but the lobby had plenty of places to sit. We were just visiting for the weekend so we fully utilized the concierge on multiple occasions for information on things to do, where to go and how to get there. He was so helpful! I do wish I realized there was a Metro stop right below the hotel- but it was a gorgeous weekend and didn't mind walking. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: scarletman1972
Reviews.Content: Some may not rate this as a five star hotel, but I found it to be a very clean, very accommodating, service-oriented hotel. It is right in the middle of the action of Montreal, Quebec. The staff is terrific. Kudos to them! French is the preffered language here but at no time did I feel deficient because my French was rusty. After a while, "sortie" becomes "exit" in your mind and so on. I felt a little sorry for the front desk people; however, as they had to repeat themselves constantly (once in French, and then in English). By the way, the Club Boneventure upgrade is well worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to train station”
Reviews.Author: Rrummen
Reviews.Content: + very large room + nice rooftop swimming pool + is connected with underground city, so you can just walk inside to train or subway - expensive breakfast, just take it yourself at train station - no free wifi in room

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: smilesaam
Reviews.Content: great room. very nice pool outdoor pool open year round. nice spacious rooms. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in an understated way.”
Reviews.Author: Coorong
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a 7 night stay at this hotel while attending a conference. it was about a 10 minute walk to the palais de congress You reach the hotel lobby via an elevator. There are 2 of them. No other elevators. The hotel describes itself as a penthouse hotel. I had a very comfortable garden view room. Standard decor. Bedding a bit warm would be my only complaint. The room had wired Internet that was more than fast enough. Wireless reception in the lobby. I loved the heated outdoor pool on both warm and cool days. An experience to be swimming outdoors when it was about 10 degrees C. In the pool was 28. They allowed me to check out late (at 2pm) so I was able to go straight to the airport. A nice touch and very welcome. I don't know if my Hilton honors silver status helped. Might have given 5 stars if there was a great cappuccino in the hotel. Fortunately I discovered the Java U at SteCatherine and McGill avenues Keep up the great work.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: OlgaBrosh
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nothing spectacular, not so pleasant looking from the outside and inside the furniture and rooms are a bit dated (but clean) and I wasn't particularly impressed with decorative style. However, the service was great! We arrived earlier than check-in time and not only did they give us a room but also upgraded it after we had to wait a little because the computer system was out of order. They were very helpful with all our questions an requests. The location is also great, it's in the center close to many attractions, right across from the railway station (convenient because we left by train) and the access to the subway is right downstairs. Also, they have a heated pool which is nice to relax in after a long day of sightseeing. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay. However, after we checked out I realized I forgot a piece of clothing in the room and when I called to enquire about it they said it has not been found. I realize It was not necessarily their fault, but still made for an unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, prime experience”
Reviews.Author: jvargas92
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in downtown Montreal - with quick access to nearby shopping and the waterfront of Old Montreal - the Hilton Montreal Bonaventure makes a great choice for your stay. Centrally located in the middle of the busy downtown area of Montreal, you have quick access to shopping a few minutes away (we walked) and the sights and experiences of Old Montreal, which is a short drive away by the waterfront. The hotel itself sits atop a business/convention center and you may not realize that you are at least 10 floors above the street level after the elevator ride up from the entrance to the hotel lobby. The hotel is a great place for business trips or families getting away for a few days. They have an amazing outdoor pool with bar service and tables. The hotel restaurant and bar is located in the main lobby and the meals we ate there were very good. I don't think you can get nicer people for hotel staff. Everyone from the bartenders to the concierge to the door man were extremely pleasant and always helpful. We took full advantage of the location to spend two afternoons in Old Montreal. Our room was a long 1-bedroom that had a sofa, a king sized bed and a desk for the off-chance of needing to do work.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you are in the catacombs of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Troy_trip
Reviews.Content: Kind of weird that you have to take an elevator up to the hotel. The lobby area is very nice, and has a unique look that is difficult to describe. The hotel is in a central location, that isn't in a particular area of interest, but is an easy walk to all those areas in any direction - Old Montreal, Bell Centre, and convention centre are all pretty close. Very easy to get to the underground system as well. For those that don't speak French, everyone from Concierges to front desk and valets spoke English which made things less stressful. Concierge was very helpful in calling restaurants for availability as well.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Staff - Impressive Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cristi67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here midweek while my son attended a concert and were pleasantly surprised at how much we liked this hotel. Although we were there for pleasure this was definitely a hotel I would choose to book a business conference at as well. Every member of the staff was very friendly and professional...and I mean EVERY...front desk, lounge attendant, valet, pool...everyone. Valet parking was quick and efficient and the in/out privileges made it worth every penny for us. The hotel decor isn't my taste, but it is up dated. Our room was not particularly spacious but there were many things that made up for that: great water pressure in the shower, nice robes/slippers,nice towels, great hair dryer, comfortable beds & bedding and clean. If we had to nitpick it would be that the desk was awkwardly placed in the room and it got in the way. No wifi in the room but wired access with cables worked just fine. We had a beautiful garden view from our room. The rooftop garden is amazing and a relaxing retreat after a day of buzzing around the city. I wouldn't say that the location is fabulous but there were lots of pluses......an entrance to underground shopping, an ethnically diverse selection of casual dining and the train station is directly across the street. We were able to walk to and from the Notre Dame Basilica in old town without any trouble (don't miss the Marie -Reine Du Monde Cathedral that is just a half block away). I've saved the best thing about the hotel for last....we definitely recommend upgrading the the Executive Lounge. The value was beyond our expectations. The lounge offers newspapers, magazines, free wifi along with a good selection of non alcoholic beverages throughout the day. This includes an awesome espresso machine that makes a nice latte. A great Managers receptions with a nice variety of hot and cold hors d'oevres, so generous we skipped dinner. A small but nice selection of wine and beer was also offered for a very reasonable cost. Breakfast was just as nice with a large variety of items, both hot and cold but not "bacon, eggs, potatoes" fare. I recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sure_tee
Reviews.Content: Let me first by saying that This Hilton in downtown montreal has been completely renovated which is a good thing seeing as it had been 10 years since i have stayed here and was wondering what the rooms lokked like. Although a little smaller than i remembered all upgraded rooms which were very much appreciated..AT check-in we were very well recieved and when we asked for any changes there wasn't a problem to switch rooms. All the rooms are on pretty much one level which was nice..There are a couple awesome courtyards with waterfalls and ponds with ducks..Very cute! Also they have an swesome out door pool which is open all year round which had a bar and many sun chairs to lounge out on. Although we did not go this time. The view from our room was amazing. It was of the downtown and at night very pretty. Very quiet, well insulated i suppose and the beds were very comfy. Very clean room as well...The buffet breakfast was simply amazing and we could take it outside to the courtyard and enjoy the beauty of the surroundings and hear the birds..lovely, lovely.Huge selection of everything from smoked salmon and real montreal bagels to croissants and a selection of jams..Scrambled eggs and bacon..everything...Great service all around..Would and will definitly return....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: DCSojourner
Reviews.Content: The star of this property is its rooftop pool. It's a great way to end your day of sightseeing before heading out to dinner. There is a poolside bar, and the pool is heated! The rooms were nice and pretty much what you'd expect from a Hilton. The only negative was the location. Though it was downtown, it was a good walk to most attractions and a taxi ride to great restaurants and bars. It is, however close to the metro and rue Saint Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal's Roof Top Resort - so unique in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Barry K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. I would stay at no other. It is unique, tranquil, friendly and very well maintained. The outdoor pool is available in all four seasons, This 'spa' like resort is excellent for a relaxing get away. Very friendly staff make this resort hotel most welcoming. My only negative comment is the overly bright lighting throughout the hallways, as well as in the rooms/bathrooms. It can be blinding, especially in late night. Softer lighting would only improve this hotel. Montreal\s subway system (Metro) is accessible from the hotel. A great way to zip around the city. Canada's VIA rail service also is directly accessible from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, excellent pool area!”
Reviews.Author: Sagiraffe
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with an amazing rooftop garden and pool area. The pool is heated and you always get a clean towel. The rooms are big and private. Breakfast is good with good variety. It is however very expensive at $29.00 pp. There are better breakfast places outside of the hotel that are far less expensive. The access to the hotels awkward and it takes some time to get use to. Hotel staff are very helpful. Overall a good experience. Definitely a place to take the family.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler025
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this downtown hotel. Itâ€™s a bit dated in some areas but the room was quite nice and the pool was comfortably heated. Service was good except we kept having to get our swipe key re-coded because apparently, it can touch NOTHING without being demagnetized. There are a number of expensive restaurants in the area. If you just want a sandwich, the train station directly across the street had a couple of nice vendors with good breads, sandwiches and coffee. There is also an â€œSAQâ€� in the train station with a good selection of wine and spirits. I recommend the Montreal Botanical Gardens for a beautiful day of sight seeing and picture perfect backdrops!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an oasis”
Reviews.Author: netplay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great though a bit old looking but the rooms and interior are great. However, once you're on the upper floors you forget that you're in a highrise building with the incredible gardens, ponds, and swimming pool which give it the most relaxing feeling. The front desk staff was also very attentive and the rooms are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TripleDeckers
Reviews.Content: We really weren't happy with this hotel. As other reviewers have noted, it is a bit of an odd setup as it is on the top floors of the building. We didn't think that would matter, but it did feel a bit odd. The hotel decor was not our style, but really what bothered us was the room. The rug had seen better days as had the bathroom shower area. It was a poolside room, which meant it was at a slightly lower level than the pool behind some foliage, which was nice for privacy, but made for a very dark room. We were upgraded to Executive privileges, so we had a lovely breakfast. The cocktail hour wasn't great - but the attendants at it and the breakfast were very friendly and helpful. The location is good for downtown Montreal, but we most likely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Swim Above the City”
Reviews.Author: SnailP
Reviews.Content: The pool makes this hotel one of Montreal's best! You can enter the pool from indoors or outdoors, making the pool is swimmable all year round. By staying on the executive floor, you have access to the Club Bonaventure, which is a lounge with complimentary beverages,continental breakfast, and hors d'oeuvres in the early evening. The hotel is located conveniently next to the metro station, also named Bonaventure, which is on the orange line. The bus stop is also only a short walk away. Chantralle, one of the hotel's concierge is extremely helpful and knowledgeable on anything you need assistance with. Armando, a waiter in the dining room, takes personal interest in your needs. Jennifer at reception, is very helpful and does an excellent job at welcoming you to the city. Maid service is very discretely attentive, and works magically around your schedule.

Reviews.Title: “unique hotel in a city”
Reviews.Author: verve511
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a couple of days in Montreal - we selected this hotel for the rooftop pool. Actually the entire hotel is on the roof! It was really unique and the gardens were very pretty. The pool was nice- not too many kids. Our only complaint was that the wi- fi did not work in our room only the lobby. We ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning the food was good and the outside patio was very relaxing. The rooms were a good size for a city hotel. Although this was a great location and nice hotel next time we might stay in old montreal since that seemed to be where we ended up each day.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel conveniently located. I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SDBLima
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, and quiet rooms. Nice bar area. Some rooms have nice inner courtyard view.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: Stephenm105
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days the food was good the had a great out door pool highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Just the best”
Reviews.Author: bngrbrgnut
Reviews.Content: This hotel, which sits on the 17th floor of a building built for the '67 Olympics, is just unique. We absolutely loved the breakfast, where you can sit inside, or outside on a lovely terrace with water gurgling by, and super service. The continental breakfast was fit for a king-nothing more needed. Very comfortable bedding. Except for one very loud night right next door to us, and their not doing anything about it for several hours (even though they sent someone, I had to call four times, and then it continued albeit more quietly), we loved our room which had pool access. There are 2 1/2 acres of water gardens up there, if you can imagine it! Beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Swimming in the snow”
Reviews.Author: 1957Steve
Reviews.Content: Popular hotel for Christmas parties so can be a little noisy. Rooms are big and service good. Underground links to most of the shopping areas - essential in winter at times. Roof top pool a real treat when air temperature outside 20 below.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: wywk
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel, the layout is a bit strange seeing it's on top of a business building and subway. Location wise it is convenient, right from the opposite side of the main train station (Gare Bonaventure) and also is connected to underground shops. It is within walking distance of most attractions and metro is close. Ordered room service for both dinner and breakfast and both was nice and fast. Food was decent, nothing to rave about. The room was nice and spacious, albeit a bit dark. It came witBathroom was nice and clean, came with a shower/tub. Also had a mini-bar, desk, tv. Internet is provided for a fee unless you are a Gold Hilton Honors member. The hotel has an outdoor heated pool /spa area which looked very tempting but I did not have time to try it out. Overall it was a decent hotel, good convenient location for visiting Montreal and service was better than usual. They called after each room service to check if everything was ok, I was also called after my stay for feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Travelzoo Special..worth the price of admission”
Reviews.Author: defiant_1950
Reviews.Content: We recently took a 5 day 4 night mioni-holiday which include Montreal, Vermont and Brockville. The executive king room including access to the executive lounge was well worth the addidional thirty dollars a day and was excellent value. In the morning a selection of toasts, muffins, croissants, smoked salmon, eggs, french toast, juice, specialty coffees, cold cuts, and newspapers. In the evening hot and cold houres d 'ouvres were available. The room itself overlooked the outdoor gardens that occupy the main level of this hotel. We arrived early and were provided with access to the lounge as our room was not yet available. We opted to sit by the outdoor pool and have a drink and relax in the sunshine. Staff was friendly and helpful and our lack of French skills presented no problem. Our only complaint was that on our level we on two seperate occassions smelt cigar and cigarette smoke in the halls. Fortunately it did not permiate our room.

Reviews.Title: “I stand by my original review of this place: nice, standard-issue chain”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Bonaventure, this time just for an overnight stopover. The glassed in garden space is pretty and nice to glance out into as I used the free lobby wifi. The rooms are what you'd expect from a Hilton, nothing more or less. My nearest ice machine was broken and the room was missing things like a do not disturb sign and coffee or tea (the coffee maker only was only stocked with decaf). Would I have chosen it if I hadn't found a good deal on Priceline? Probably not. But it fulfilled my needs for the night: a good bed to sleep in, just a few steps from the 747 shuttle stop from the airport. The next morning I was able to hop on the metro just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with travelzoo voucher”
Reviews.Author: Cdnclan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gardens. Walls of rooms could've been a little more soundproofed (or neighbors a little quieter). Very nice rooms & fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to attractions”
Reviews.Author: 2sisterstravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central to attractions that most tourists will want to visit. It is across the street from the train station which has many wonderful quick places to grab breakfast and/or lunch. It is a clean hotel with a nice outdoor heated pool and a restaurant. The beds are comfortable and the shower was hot and powerful. We were able to catch a taxi in to Old Montreal. But make sure you grab a taxi number when you are ready to come back. We were lucky to find taxi. There is a business room to use the internet but it cost money. There is free wi-fi and room, but in order to use the room internet you need a cable. Don't worry about learning French - most of the staff understand English and are VERY helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at the Bonaventure Hilton again!”
Reviews.Author: Raymond B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bonaventure Hilton for three nights at the end of July, 2011, at an exorbitant rate of $270 (Cdn) per night, plus multiple taxes. The bathroom in my room was revolting - with a smear of 'you know what' on the bathtub rim when I arrived, and more of the same on the rubber bath mat two days later. Disgusting! My completion of a Customer Survey card upon departure expressing my concerns, and my subsequent e-mail of complaint to the Bonaventure Hotel, were met with total silence - no response whatsoever. Customer Service is apparently non-existent at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is top notch.”
Reviews.Author: Ykhan66
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay here was fantastic. I have zero complaints. The staff (everyone i interacted with e.g. Front desk, concierge, doorman, life guard) were all super friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very nice and clean, and cleaned very well daily (minus one minor towel issue). The location was fantastic - can virtually walk or subway anywhere around the city from here, you don't even need to go outside (good for the winter).

Reviews.Title: “Good if you like retro 70s style!”
Reviews.Author: helenann2k
Reviews.Content: My husband had business in Montreal and my daughter and I decided to join him for three dys to visit the sites around Montreal. The hotel room itself was fine. Comfortable mattress, plenty of room (we had a King room with a pull out sofa), etc. No mini bar, it had been replaced with a small refrigerator. The problems with the hotel were the odd layout. The hotel is at the top of an office building and so first you have to take the correct elevators to get to the lobby. Then, there are various halls leading off the lobby like spokes of a wheel, with small stairs leading to each hall. The lobby has clearly been updated, but the carpet, some furnishings, and the general feel of the place are right out of the 1970s (think the Brady Bunch). Now, I didn't like it, but my husband and 14 year old thought it was a great retro vibe, and they really liked the place. To me, I wanted a more traditional lobby, elevators, and upated carpeting. I will add pictures to this review soon. The concierge desk was not helpful when we asked for information on various sites. Each time we asked, they handed us the same map. The breakfast buffet was good, but the older waiter we had was very grumpy. Otherwise the rest of the staff was pleasant. Pool area is beautiful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: MaiCho
Reviews.Content: We found this deal on some travel site and we stayed 3 nts at this hotel. We got 2 double beds room (which for the rate we paid, its definitely worth and we didn't care to ask for upgrade or anything). We got to Montreal via Via Rail and arrived there around 5pm rush hour. The hotel is connected to the underground city and it was only less than 3 minutes walk from the train station to the hotel underground. Very nice and bright room. The conceiges are friendly and they show us the way to get around the city (both underground and above). It was less than 15 minutes walk to the Bell Centre and other restaurants, shops in downtown montreal and around 30 minutes walk to Old Montreal. The only thing is if you plan to walk underground beyond 730, you should expect the shops are closed and the traffic is rather not too busy, but its connected to the Eatons centre which is closed around 830 I believe. The only down side is on our 2nd nts, we encountered with this college/ university grp and they were very loud right through 2 a.m. in the morning. It was a bit irritating and we made complains to the hotel couple times. It was pretty bad that other guests from the other rooms walked out to talk to the teenagers. Other than that, our stay was really decent and for the price we paid, we definitely would want to go back again. PS. the swimming pool is spectacular - too bad the weather was bit cold for a swim.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location Once You're Outside”
Reviews.Author: upthehudson
Reviews.Content: This Hilton was easily visible as we drove up Rue University. The friendly doorman greeted us as we pulled up to the front entrance. For check-in we were pointed to elevators just inside the doorway. Then it became unusual. The elevator only stops at 2 floors: this entrance and the main lobby 17 floors up! In fact, once you get off to search for registration, you will learn that all rooms and services [except the banquet rooms] are located a few steps up or down from this lobby. So check in occurs within view of the rooftop pool and gardens.What an odd configuration for this otherwise classic Hilton property, especially if you simply want to step outside. And allow plenty of time for running back to the car if you want to retrieve something during your stay. Back down to the doorman then down a corridor to a different bank of elevators to bring you to the garage below street level. Also odd was that apparently management equates allergies to down/feathers with being handicapped. Our reservation request for for a feather free room resulted in a delay in gaining access to that specifically designated room. You guessed it - helpful rails in the bathroom. Otherwise, nice sized room, comfortable bed, quiet night's sleep. The staff was professional (though not so bubbly). You probably are best off with a breakfast package as the Hilton restaurant is typically expensive. And while the hotel is ideally located between the old City and the modern shopping district, any breakfast alternative would still be a 15 minute walk. Once we got used to the Hilton's dynamics, it was a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape!”
Reviews.Author: WJ_Co
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed for 4 nights at the end of July and had a lot of fun. The rooftop garden, pool, common areas and rooms are all very nice, clean and serene. Great place to start and finish a day of sightseeing in Montreal. Some people mention its a bit of a walk to get to your room because the rooms are situated in a big ring but its totally worth it considering its to accomodate ponds, waterfalls, streams with goldfish, ducks and beautiful gardens. The staff were all great but a special thanks to Maurizio the lifeguard. The hotel is in the business area so there isnt that much within a 10 minute walk but after ten minutes your into cool sections of the city any direction you travel. I wouldnt go anywhere else during my next visit to Montreal. Pros: Many sites close by Architecture/landscaping Cleanliness Staff Peacefulness Cons: Limited covenience stores close by Rooms are a bit small No complimentary Wi-Fi

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but it will cost you!”
Reviews.Author: Sookie9007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, short drive to the Old City. It was raining so we did not do a lot of on foot exploration. The room was quite pricey but we did get access to the Excecutive Lounge for snacks in the evening and breakfast the next morning. That was the most enjoyable part of the stay actually, the staff in the lounge were great! When we first tried to check in around 2 we were told to come back later, no offer to find us a room even though we insisted because it was cold and raining outside. The front desk and conceirge were not as helpful as I would have hoped for just because we do not know Montreal at all. Overall not a bad stay but quite expensive (parking is about $25 extra) and the rooms are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Quality downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: pauljames403
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this property twice now. Good location downtown Montreal, walking distance to both Old Montreal tourist area as well as prime Montreal shopping district. Although the real shopping district is about a 20 minute walk, it can be covered all underground within Montreal's underground shopping system. Also very close to mass public transit. About 40 minute trip from airport. Montreal has a standard zone fair so all airport to downtown is about $35 fair. hotel is quite high end being a full bred Hilton, as opposed to their junior brands such as Garden Inn, hampton etc. As such rates are a little higher. Typical here would be $200 range but that is quite common in downtown Montreal. i have stayed in fact at their sister location, downtown Hilton Garden Inn and it was only a few dollars cheaper. Hotel has very good dinning and bar services. Large outdoor pool that is heated and open year round. Fitness facilities. Exec floor facilities if you are a Hilton rewards member, and all round maintains Hilton standards very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelboundsandiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days for family get-together (including grandparents and teenage kids). It was the perfect location downtown as we were a couple of blocks to St. Catherine Street and only a 10 - 15 minute walk to Old Montreal. The teens saw the midnight showing of Harry Potter opening night and were able to walk back to the hotel. Many cafes close by. The rooms were comfortable. The fitness center was well equipped and the pool area was lovely and relaxing. The hotel and lobby are actually above the conference center and the lobby sits on the roof level so you need to take an elevator up. We requested a room near the elevator for the grandparents so they wouldn't have to walk to far.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent”
Reviews.Author: GeoffL
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel since 1977. The location is perfect, the roof top swimming pool area was in full swing, very relaxing. Yes, this is a business hotel, but perfect for the family with kids as well. Worthy of note on this sweltering summer weekend was the room for sleeping, pillows were fluffy and abundant, A/C worked great, bed very comfortable, no street or hall noise, my wife and I slept very doundly. Front desk staff very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “MOTEL LEVEL RATING”
Reviews.Author: polterauer
Reviews.Content: The hotel surely was very nice 30 years ago but no it has reached a stage where it certainly does not deserve the renowned Hilton name. It is worn out; dirty; and the serve matches this too. Not sure if the carpets whereas dirty as they looked but anyways ... Room not cleaned at 17:30; no dedicated parking for the hotel; no showing room on check in; I could go on ....... Fazit I was supposed to stay for a week; checked out after one day. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for exploring MontrÃ©al”
Reviews.Author: TomTom_Tom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton MontrÃ©al Bonaventure for four nights at the beginning of July, and greatly enjoyed the experience. Our biggest challenge was up front: finding the hotel while driving in MontrÃ©al. The hotel, including reception, is located on the top two floors of the Bonaventure building (at the time of construction the largest office building in the world), and the signs to the driveway were of rather modest size. But once there, things improved quickly. Parking was plentiful, if paid (as can be expected in a city hotel) as the Bonaventure has a large underground parking garage. Take the elevator to the ground floor, a second elevator to reception, and a short walk later we were checking in. Friendly service in both French and English, and quickly we had our room (executive room on the "second" floor, facing the gardens). Oh yes, the gardens: while the Bonaventure has brutalist architecture with lots of exposed concrete, the top floors have extensive gardens with trees, greenery and even koi ponds. And a large outdoor pool ... The rooms were large and clean, with nary a noise to be heard from next door (one advantage of concrete, to be sure). A few details in the bathrooms belied the age of the hotel, but renovations over the years have kept the rooms at a top-notch level. And the cleaning service kept the rooms impeccable. With the executive floor you also get access to the executive lounge (Bonaventure Club), which offers a highly impressive continental breakfast, including MontrÃ©al bagels and other breads and pastries; cold cuts and cheeses; some warm items varying by the day; a good-quality espresso machine; and all the other usual suspects for continental breakfast. Hors d'oeuvres from 5 PM to 7 PM were generous and had lots of variety, too: we saw a number of people clearly using them as a dinner substitute.
