The hotel location was within a 15-minute walk of the old city, of shopping on St-Catherine Street, and of Place-des-Arts and other venues for the MontrÃ©al Jazz Festival. And less than 30 minutes from Mount Royal for those looking for a bit of good exercise. (The fitness centre was also quite large and well-equipped in case you prefer to walk or run inside.)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Average Service.”
Reviews.Author: GrisGrisNewYork
Reviews.Content: The best thing of this hotel is the location right above the Bonaventure metro station. It is great for those who like to tour on their own and are looking for easy access to public transportation. If you are an avid traveler this hotel is just your average hilton. There is nothing special in their room decor or service from the staff. They do have nice amenities such as the pool and fitness center with top of the line equipment but since we didn't use any of that I cannot offer comments. My average rating is for the small glitches that I encountered from beginning to end. However, location is excellent. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. The A/C did make a "clonking" noise every time it turned on...never been to a hotel were the a/c made such noise. Everything was in working order. The lighting could have been better...it was a little on the dimmed side and one could not control it. The area of our room was quiet (a plus). Overall the hotel served its purpose of providing clean shelter, easy access to the metro and served bkfst. We didn't do dinner at this location we explored the local restaurants instead. Valet is $20. I would return for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: dr_tiffcliff
Reviews.Content: This is an older (mid 20th century) hotel that has a lot of concrete walls and some steps (rooms are on two levels that are "split" from the lobby), but the hotel has been well maintained. Our stay was uneventful and easy; the king w/ a sofabed was a great setup for our family. The metro was a great option for sight-seeing -- kids 6 and under ride for free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay when sightseeing in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: psc4106
Reviews.Content: Typical Hilton. Good service, comfy beds, good restaurant, no surprises. I liked it a lot. Great location for sightseeing downtown as most sites and lots of good restaurants are within 10-15 minutes walking. To go further afield there's a subway just down the block and in bad weather like I had you can get to the subway without going outside though it's a bit convoluted and not well marked. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central Montreal”
Reviews.Author: phasmid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Bonaventure in May 2011. This is a nice centrally located property with easy access to the subway and shopping galore. It's also about a 15 - 20 minute walk to the old town or Chinatown. We found our room to be quiet, large and nicely appointed. The hotel is located on the top 2 or 3 floors of the Bonaventure so the outside rooms are up far enough off the street to be quiet. If you want a really quiet room ask for one facing the court yard. The hotel also has a heated outdoor pool that is very nice and the executive lounge was above average. If you don't plan on using your car during your stay (there's really no need) use the self parking. It's $19/day but cheaper than valet at $25. The subway is very easy to use but the Montreal under ground can be a challenge. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location & comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: snorkelhappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nites with family. We arrived mid-morning and 2 rooms were ready for us to check-in. Staff was attentive, but sometimes too attentive -- while we were taking a nap, the housekeeping staff opened our doors twice within a couple of hours. We thought this was a little unusual. The steps that other reviewers have noted, make it a little difficult if you are lugging large bags, but we didn't have a problem. We had dinner one night in the bar (the restaurant didn't seem to be open for dinner) -- the staff in the bar was great. The food was much better than we expected, and the portions were very large. The location of the hotel is very convenient with the train/subway station connected to the hotel. We used the subway, cabs, and bixi bikes to get arround during our short stay. The beds are super comfy; and rooms are clean and comfortable. We would stay here again when visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A good central point to explore Montreal”
Reviews.Author: rhweatherly
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here for our anniversary this June, and couldn't have been happier about the room and accomodations. We checked in during a protest due to an economic conference being held at the hotel, and wondered if this would result in a difficult stay. It's hard to relax with armed security at every corner, but fortunately our check in was seamless and simple. We arrived early, and went to the concierge for a lunch suggestion (which turned out well!). We then came back to the hotel and had a couple of drinks poolside before heading out for dinner. As a Hilton Diamond member, I had access to the Executive Lounge, and in keeping with the tradition I found it to be well stocked and maintained at all times. I especially liked the honor system cocktails - it sure made getting drinks handled much easier. My only complaint was a lack of choices in the bar area - not a bourbon or Tennessee whiskey in sight. Alas, I made do... The rest of our stay was excellent. The concierges are a critical piece of this hotel for travellers, both business and leisure. The stand is right by the front desk, and usually double staffed for efficiency. My only concerns with this hotel overall are related to parking and subway access. We valet parked at $28/day so we could take the car out multiple times, but might have self parked for $19/day and used the subway (we always prefer to use public transit when we travel). Either way, it's a little on the pricey side. The subway access is a VERY long walk through the bowels of the building to get to the station below it. Hotel management should look into improving access to the subway to improve it's versatility for vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, interesting architecture”
Reviews.Author: Rengrrl
Reviews.Content: Convenient downtown location with easy access to the Metro, walking distance to old town and close to shops and restaurants. The architecture and layout of the hotel are interesting and distinctive, although perhaps not to everyone's taste. The year round outdoor pool sold the hotel for me. The experience of swimming outdoors at night, looking up at the skyscrapers when it was 0 degrees out was one I will never forget. Since it was still winter I didn't get to appreciate the extensive landscaping and rooftop gardens. Nice room, but the hallways could use some freshening up. Some minor noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: crash2224
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Montreal. Close to all everything you need and the metro is underneath the hotel. The service is fantastic and no you do not need to know french. Excellent restaurants and shops beside this hotel. Definitely a place I would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, usual Hilton standard”
Reviews.Author: suek42
Reviews.Content: Staying here was very comfortable. Everything clean & of a high standard. The room service breakfast was reasonably priced & plentiful. We saved the muffins for morning tea each day. The only hiccup were the inconsiderate guests who held a loud conversation outside of our room at 1 am. Difficult for the staff to stop!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True!”
Reviews.Author: DawnVT
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival both my husband and I felt like we had walked into paradise! From the remarkably tasteful decor, contemporary yet full of sunlight and nature to the warm greetings from staff it was love at first sight! Celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary we wanted a special overnight escape and the Hilton was perfect. We noted others had expressed concern with traveling through the wings of the hotel with the gentle steps separating levels. We noted this to give an intimate continuous feel. To make our stay extra special we did upgrade to the Executive Level. Pure bliss! The hors d'oeuvres in the evening were very European, fresh and even healthy. With summer upon us we were able to enjoy not only an evening on the terrace (beautiful greenery). With the underground mall connected to the Hilton exploring in bad weather is even easy. The sun beckoned us outdoors so we took a quick 10 minute walk to Old Montreal and ended up staying there over 3 hours. So many galleries, artists, great shops and cafes to enjoy. Upon returning to the Hilton we headed to our room to prepare for dinner. As a soap connoisseur I thoroughly enjoyed the Crabtree & Evelyn amenities. Our room was clean and smelled wonderful. The beds were so comfortable, one could just get lost in sleep. Out our window was bright greenery and a view of the path through the gardens outside (side note: the gardens are such a joy to take your time and walk through. The ducks were a neat surprise and the experience was grounding). I kept thinking of the Hilton roof top pool. Both it, the chairs in the sun and the bar area looked so relaxing --- but there was only so much time so off to dinner! We met with the concierge to assist us in making our dinner choice (I longed for seafood, my husband was thinking steak). After discovering our likes our concierge made a quick phone call and our reservation was confirmed. Within a beautiful two minute walk we arrived at our restaurant and were recognized and seated immediately. Dinner was exactly what we had hoped for (magnificent service Madame Concierge). After a great night's sleep the breakfast offering was welcoming and truly enjoyable on the terrace. Fresh smoked salmon and trout, choice of cheeses, hard boiled eggs, fresh fruit & more! We couldn't have been more happy with our rare and well-deserved night away! Thank you Hilton! Happy 20th Anniversary Mike!

Reviews.Title: “Unique layout”
Reviews.Author: Crystelshine
Reviews.Content: Hilton Bonaventure definitely provides bang for your buck. The layout for this hotel is very unique. It has many "wings" and each wing has access to its own private pool. It also has many water features and excellent landscaping throughout the outdoor patios that are accessible privately via the rooms. You don't even realize that you are on the 17th floor once you get off the main elevator at the reception level and the view of the city from that floor is breathtaking. The staff is quite friendly and accomodating. The only drawback: wired interenet only available for 1 computer in each room. Wireless internet is only available in the lobby. However, I enjoyed my stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Noise, Noise, Noise !!! One problem after another”
Reviews.Author: boxingday2010
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with Hilton many times. This is the worst one so far. First of all, we were assigned a room which was next to a wedding party. They did not have good sound proofing rooms. You can hear everything from the next room. I couldn't sleep until 3am in the morning. The bed had sharp corners, which I didn't realize because it was covered by some fabric, so I banged my leg into it by accident. This is not a children friendly place. It will be dangerous for kids to run around in the room. We stayed there for two days. The next day, we talked to the front desk and we have requested for a room change. They changed the room for us, except the room had a faulty toilet. It leaked and it flooded the whole washroom floor, including the hallway of the room. We didn't get an apology from any of the staff for the inconvenience. Overall, we did not have a good experience. We are Hilton honours members. This time we felt very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel average, great location, not for seniors with mobility issues.”
Reviews.Author: breezehill
Reviews.Content: First of all, staff is very attentive and polite. Pool and garden area very impressive although we didn't use it. We (my 84 yr old relatively spry mother and I) had booked to stay at this hotel for 3 nights, we only stayed for one. Location right across from the train station is excellent, but there is only stairs - no ramp, no elevator to get up into the building. Ramp and main entrance is off the main road and not easily accessed. Long walk around inside of building to get to elevators. Rooms are very ordinary - clean but tired looking, although they have apparently been updated recently. There are more stairs to get into hallway to go to the rooms - the area we had did not have a ramp to use either. All in all a big disappointment and not worth the price. We moved to Hotel de la Montaigne - what a beautiful difference! Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Funky and fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay here four nights recently and really had a nice stay. This is an interesting hotel, in a terrific central location with a wonderful crew working there. I would definitely go back. Staff: Everyone I came in contact with was very pleasant. Front desk check in was friendly and efficient. The lady who checked me in gave me some recommendations for local restaurants that were great. Housekeeping was very nice and I liked the chocolates when they turned down my bed. Must give a shout out to Guy in the Bonaventure Club where I had breakfast every morning. He was so helpful and friendly and really is a credit to his profession. Facilities: This hotel is oddly laid out. The hotel itself is atop an office building so you must take an elevator up to the lobby area. There is extensive use of concrete so it looks a bit dated but the dÃ©cor is very nice and there are multiple inner courtyards that help bring nature indoors. I enjoyed my room with a king bed. It was very comfortable and spacious. Towels were nice and thick and toiletries were good. The common areas are also nicely decorated and comfortable, as is the bar in the lobby area. The gym is very well equipped and clean. There is a separate yoga/stretching room. This is one of the best gyms Iâ€™ve seen in a Hilton property. Highlights: The highlight of the hotel has to be the heated outdoor pool. You can enter the pool by going down a set of steps inside the building right near the gym and then swim out under a low sill into the pool area. Probably not too energy efficient but it is very cool and was well used even though it was very chilly when I was there. The staff (esp. Guy) in the Bonaventure Club was also a highlight. Also, this hotel is very conveniently located. Youâ€™re almost on top of the Bonaventure metro station and can easily get to the Bell Centre and McGill University through the underground passageways. That came in handy when it was raining! Areas for improvement: It was cold when I was there so I would imagine in warmer weather there is more foliage in the courtyard areas. Some colorful plants or flowers would be nice. Also, it would be nice if there were not so many stairs everywhere but I donâ€™t think theyâ€™d be able to retrofit the hotel very easily. Overall impression: I liked this hotel a lot. The location was great, the staff was friendly and the funky architecture grew on me after awhile. The room was comfortable and exceptionally clean. Nearby transportation: Very close to metro lines and only one block from the airport express bus which will get you downtown in no time for only $8.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel, but don't upgrade. Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Thebrit0068
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a one night stay at the Hilton. It's right across the stree from the rail station and less than a 10 minute walk to the Bell Centre. perfect Location. When I booked, I was given the option of upgrading to the Executive floor for an extra $40. I took them up on the deal but was dissapointed. The Executive floor is on the same level as the check-in desk and I was hoping for something a bit higher up with a view of Montreal. Didn't get it. The deluxe continental breakfast was anything but deluxe. Some meats, some toast, the odd dry sweet item, but at least the orange juice was good. And to top it off, for that extra $40 there was no free in-room Wi-Fi. Their free access is either via phone line (so you are screwed if you only have an Ipod touch), or some sort of TV internet that I couldn't be botherd trying to figure out as I didn't have time. Other than that, the Pool and Garden did look quite nice, but didn't have a chance to enjoy. Would I go back? Probably, but not at the rates they charged, especially if it's more than one night. I have been in much better Hiltons at a lower cost than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service!”
Reviews.Author: thai4006
Reviews.Content: Exquisite. outstanding. Stayed on the executive floor. found staff to be super attentive. room decor was soothing. location is great. excellent soundproofing between rooms. in room coffee was bland but other than that no complaints. highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some peculiarities”
Reviews.Author: LighthouseKeeper1
Reviews.Content: First the good: our room had a great view, looking out over the Red Roses Flour Factory and the St. Lawrence River, very sunny and old-Montreal-industrial. Although I didn't use it, the pool seemed kind of interesting. Heated in winter, it's on the top floor of the building. I had breakfast at the restaurant one day, and it was good, if pricey. The gym was fine--and clean. Then the less good: the main thing was the building. I wouldn't stay here if I had mobility problems. There are stairs to get from the street level to the elevator which one needs to take to reach the lobby. The stairs are difficult enough for an able-bodied person, particularly with luggage. There was a needless flight of stairs, down and up to the exact same level, on the way from the reception to the room. The other problem with the building is that we were awakened on two of the nights of our stay by clanging pipes. We did speak with the concierge about it, and he offered to look into it, but frankly I'm not sure what someone is going to do in a full hotel about banging pipes in our room. It seems like an endemic problem with the heating or plumbing system not something that maintenance can fix in a few minutes during our stay. Maybe, but we turned him down on the offer because by the time we mentioned it, it was evening again and we just wanted to go to bed. I don't think it should have happened in the first place, and I doubt we were the first with the issue. The other less than fantastic thing was the details of the room. There was no hair dryer, just the conical top for one. There were no sewing, shoe polishing or other types of amenities: just soap, shampoo, and conditioner. There was a coffee maker in the room, but once we used the one herbal tea, it wasn't replaced for three days (at which point I asked for another). The coffee goes into paper cups instead of glass ones. The hotel claims to be "green," but I think--not so much (particularly with the outdoor heated pool in winter). There was free cable internet, but it was slow. To get a faster speed one had to pay. Why not just provide proper internet service? I expect the location is fine for business events--the prices at the restaurants suggest they get business travellers on expense accounts--but I wouldn't recommend it for a holiday. There aren't many nice restaurants or other nice Montreal things in the immediate vicinity. I'm totally certain one can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrangeSquirrel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a mini-vacation over Labor Day weekend. The rooms were very modern, clean and comfortable. The hotel was centrally located, and we walked everywhere - to Ste. Catherine Street, to Old Montreal, etc. The staff was hot and cold -- some were friendly and helpful, others were aloof and not as willing to address our needs. The pool area was lovely, and hard to believe it was situated high above the city. The fitness center was adequate, with lots of cardio and weight options. We had access to the Executive Lounge during our stay, and the breakfast and snacks provided were pretty good. I found the rates to be a bit pricey, but overall I thought this was a great place to stay while visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Loacation helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: prevfromPurley
Reviews.Content: Stayed in cold December 2010 and found it great that we could get to shops and restaurants without going outside. The Via Rail train station is close by and again can be accessed by walking underground. Took a cab to the old town for a great dinner one evening booked by the concierge after we asked him to book something that mid range in price. The staff were always very helpful in giving us directions and advising us on wich sites to see. The bar and bistro area serve good food but a bit expensive. Rooms were standard hotel rooms but nice furnishings and bathroom was small but had everything you needed. Visited Jean-Talon market which was not big or interesting as we had hoped. The subway there was easy enough though. Mary Queen of the World church just up the street from the hotel was beautiful and a must see. Would definately stay at this hotel again as the location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of everything. We parked a car with the valet on the first day but took it out of valet due to being able to park under the hotel. The hotel is a great location, direct access to the subway system, walking distance to both Old Montreal and St. Catherines street. Is a great business hotel, rooms are good size. Room did have a funny smell to it, not off putting just strange.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to its Hilton name.”
Reviews.Author: felecia123
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a bit outdated. Clean and friendly service. NOTHING is included in the price of your stay, not even local calls! Parking not included, breakfast not included...The actual location is not the best... Facing to the Down town terminal, so not the nicest scenery. Best part was the workout facilities. I am sure that there are nicer hotels for the same price. I would recommend shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: sheckleremporium
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bonaventure many times and it is our place to stay in downtown Montreal. I'm sure an elevator ride to the front desk isn't for everyone but it is one of the unique features we enjoy. It is part of the undeground city so you can shop without bundling up for the weather.Close the the Bell Center also. The rooftop, outdoor pool is great in the winter, especially at night. The rooms are clean and spacious. The downside of the hotel is that there are no vending machines and the little store, when open, is very expensive. Also, time to get wireless!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Karen668297
Reviews.Content: When I was booking this hotel online I hesitated on whether I should book the room only or go for the bed and breakfast. I was not dissapointed when I finally decided to go for the bed and breakfast. The buffet was fantastic with plenty of selection. The pool was a wonderful winter experience. The room was very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The only downside was it is a far walk with luggage from the public parking area to the room and a lot of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: lovecentralamerica
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights just before the new year, and I have to say it was a very pleasant stay. Staff: very helpful Rooms: very good and comfortable Bar: rather overpriced (about $10 for a beer) The "gare centrale" is very close, within waling distance, as is the metro station. Make sure to go for a swim in the terrance pool, especially pretty in the winter with steam rising off the water and looking at some tall buildings. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quality Stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Gundlach
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two teenage daughters from Boxing Day until 12/30/10. We had booked through HHonors and a prior phone cal'l assured a larger room at no additional cost (double queen versus double double with free wifi). When we went to check in the room wasn't ready, I noticed on the website that the executive lounge was closed and I usually ask for an upgrade even if I have to pay a little extra since the continental breakfasts are typically all we need and eating breakfast at the hotel is usually very expensive. Anyway, I asked for free wifi instead of the upgrade to executive level and they said, 'what the heck its the holidays' - Off to a good start. They said that the room would be ready in 20-30 minutes (it was 2:40PM - check in is at 3PM - never had trouble checking in early before, but they said I had the last double queen left). It was 3:15 when I was informed the room was not yet ready and the desk staff offered us free drink vouchers for the bar - ALL RIGHTY THEN - they gave us two worth two drinks. Nice gesture for making us wait. 20 minutes or so passed and the room and the room was finally ready when the staff asked if we wanted our bags brought up (they having been with the bell staff already) - I said, 'I am surprised they aren't already there with the wait and all', the staff noticed my displeasure and asked if we enjoyed the drinks at the bar, I said we did, but it was a little embarassing with my family and all waiting in the lobby all this time; they then offered us free breakfast vouchers. I was a bit embarrassed, saying that it was not necessary, but also knowing this was like $100 worth of breakfast. She insisted and I took the vouchers. The room was worth the wait, it was huge and big enough for 4 adults which is rare at any hotel unless you upgrade to a suite, which we have done on many occassions. The hotel is awesome, the architecture is very period, it is in a great location and offers many ammenities. It is directly connected to the RESO (underground and subways) and the staff is very nice and very accommodating. They treated us very well. The sleep quality is incredibly good. The room was the quietest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. We had neighbors on both sides and across the hall and never heard them once. We used the outdoor heated pool in the middle of winter, which was cool (pun intended). The bar and resturant were very good, and the service was very, very good, especially the bell staff and greeters/valet, they really set the tone. I am looking forward to staying here in better climes as the gardens and grounds look as if they are very nice. TIP: use the valet parking if you want to charge parking to the room as the parking is independent of the hotel and you can only charge parking to your room if you use valet as oppossed to self parking ($2 or $3 extra) - Another tip: if travelling to Canada and Boxing Day is on a weekend, the banks are closed on Monday and Tuesday following and you have to use ATMs or exchange kiosks to exchange money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulEBNJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and has fascinating architecture. My rooms was a generous size and nicely appointed. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful. I had a room overlooking the pool courtyard. Watching people swimming with steam rising from the pool in the Montreal winter is quite a sight.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong with this Place- they get your money at every turn though”
Reviews.Author: mabish
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and its rooms were very nice, and even though I was just looking at snow on top of everything (not a garden) outside my window, even though I payed for a garden view room. I didn't like the fact that some rooms take a long time to get to from the lobby, as the hotel is just a big square (no separate floors) and I had to walk pretty far. Free wifi was great, and the location was very good as well, being just up the street from St Catherine. The doormen were very nice and always willing to answer questions as well. One thing that I could not get over was regarding the mini fridge. If you wanted to get anything cool you would either need to a) only have room for 1 bottle as the minibar was full of stuff leaving no room, b) pay $10 a night for them to send up another minifridge, or c) pay $50 for the front desk to come and empty your minifridge so you can put your own stuff in it (and if you do it yourself, they will still charge you $50). That whole system is bull, and that's why this hotel takes your money at every turn. Also, there are no free local calls. My opinion- if you want to spend the money, then its a great choice when in Montreal, but prepare to be gauged.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AsIfOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location - right across from the train station was very convenient, but the directions might be better marked as we ended up turning left when we should have turned right and walked around the block before we found it. Great rooms and service. The hotel's location rooftop, and the little river they've created with tons of greenery make it seem like a little oasis when you get back from shopping or viewing the sites. Our room was "river side" so instead of looking out onto traffic, we had the sound of water bubbling and birds chirping. The amenities are also great. The buffet breakfast is really very good.

Reviews.Title: “Most Unique Hilton Ever”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Bonaventure in November. I arrived after nightfall and entered the very spartan lobby unaware the real lobby was nine floors above my head. The elevator I was directed to by the kind doorman only had one button beyond the ground floor so I assumed I was only going up one floor. Wrong! The hotel occupies the top two floors of the building. That said, once you are on the "main" floor of the hotel, there is a half staircase going up to the "top" floor and a half staircase going down to the "bottom" floor. The restaurant, lounge, gift shop, front desk and club lounge are on the "middle" floor. The hallways are a bit dated but the rooms are excellent. The windows on the inside look out on to a rooftop courtyard/garden/pool area. The outside rooms look out on to Montreal. My room looked on to the pool, which is heated year-round and always seemed occupied, morning and evening. At night, there was a cover over it. The gym is down below the "bottom" floor and is well equipped. The pool is accessed from the same area with a host/hostess to provide towels. The club lounge offered evening drinks and food and breakfast each morning with an excellent selection. The staff was beyond courteous and helpful. English was readily spoken, which I found true of everywhere I went in Montreal. The location is fabulous, connected to the underground areas of the city and to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with Teens”
Reviews.Author: PEIVisitor
Reviews.Content: Recently in Montreal to attend a concert with my teen Grand daughter and her friend. We chose the Bonaventure after much consideration due to it's proximity to the bell Centre( concert Venue and also Hockey Game Venue which my husband was attending). The decision could not have been better.The Bonaventure is connected to Montreal's extensive underground City, lots of shopping, a skating rink, movie theatres...we were thrilled. To say nothing of the friendly hotel staff..to a person they were helpful and welcoming. This is obviously a very well run facility. The management and staff should be proud.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A UNIQUE AND MODERN HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: adman_10
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL BLEW MY MIND. I couldn't believe the unique design of this hotel. Placed on the top 2 floors of the Bonaventure business centre with indoor access to the subway system this hotel was a last minute find, but AN ABSOLUTE GEM. situated in between the major shopping areas and old Montreal we walked everywhere. While the staff could speak better engligh we didn't mind because they were more than willing to try everything to get us the answer we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Snarth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a 5 day conference and found it exceptionally comfortable with great conference facilities. Very large rooms, great beds and free wi-fi were a plus, and the location is fantastic. I often end up with disappointing room service at meetings, but here the food was very good, service was prompt and the staff were extremely helpful. The decor in the public spaces is really unusual-- very bold and almost appealingly ugly-- not like the usual pallid atmosphere you get in a chain hotel. It is not an intimate place but if you want a large hotel, it seemed likea great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: 2togoNebraska
Reviews.Content: I was there on leisure, my husband had a conference to attend. The bed was very comfortable. Since I have neck and back issues this is really important. The location is fantastic. There is a metro station available without going outside and you can walk anywhere in the downtown area and down to Old Montreal. The concierge service was wonderful - felt they really cared about helping me and enjoyed their job. If I return to Montreal, I will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 2paul
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in this hotel since it had only recently been renovated. It is located in the heart of downtown Montreal and very close to Old Montreal and the shopping district. The hotel has only 3 levels but covers a very wide area. There is a garden with water falls and a heated pool in the middle of the hotel. Valet parking is very convenient and quick. The room we stayed in had a king bed with a sofa bed. Cabled internet was complimentary. Room service was prompt and food was tasty. Would definitely recommend it to others for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrewTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great addition to our trip to Montreal. The interior is really interesting with original art and a unique floor plan. Outdoor pool right next to the lobby. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Room was above average in size and looked out over an inner courtyard. The only thing that prooved diffucult was getting our luggage to the room. Lots of twists and turns and some portions with only stairs (no elevator). Staff would probably have assisted if we had requested.

Reviews.Title: “Just about Ok I would say”
Reviews.Author: lovayager
Reviews.Content: It is a downtown hotel located close to all business establishments in Montreal. The hotel itself is housed on the top floors of a high rise building with access through the elevator. The highpoint of the hotel is the garden and the heated pool on the terrace. I did not find any great reason to pay more for the Club room in which I stayed. For the price difference one should happily opt for the normal rooms. Hotel staff is helpful and courteous. No greta eating options in the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Quirky--But that can be a good thing!”
Reviews.Author: RoadRash
Reviews.Content: I'd most echo the comments of other reviewers--it's an unusual property with excellent customer service, dynamite location, and high quality accommodations. To a person, the staff were superlative. The best example is that I asked the front desk clerk if he had any suggestions where I might find a screw to replace one that had fallen out of my eyeglasses. He said he'd send a maintenance person to my room, which seemed odd. Sure enough, the maintenance man arrived within minutes, bringing along a set of very small screwdrivers. He hadn't realized that I also needed the screws, which of course he didn't have. I thanked him for his trouble, and minutes after he left I received a call from the concierge suggesting both a close-by store that would be open in the morning, and somewhat less convenient store that was open that night. I consider that above-average service for a concierge, but what just blew me away was that the maintenance man would take the initiative to have the concierge call me. Clearly someone here is thinking about customer service--bravo! The room was nicely appointed and the beds were shear delight to sleep in. My only complaint is that the room was a bit small--but then we were squeezing a family of four in, so that's not too surprising. I'd definitely stay here again. In fact, I'd look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Re-living the beautiful 70's”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsLinda
Reviews.Content: Entering the Hilton Bonaventure brings back good memories from the 70's: unlimited space in the lobby and other common areas, very spacious rooms, superb restaurant and roof garden areas. It is a great hotel, with very good food; all staff were wonderful. Only issue: the extortionate parking fee of $25/day.

Reviews.Title: “Neat -- A Little Different”
Reviews.Author: TravelCheapskate
Reviews.Content: Got this on Priceline for our second day in the city. The property is kind of dated, vintage 1980's, but that makes for an interesting change of pace. There is an outdoor pool and garden on the 5th or 6th floor. Very novel and unusual. Kids really enjoyed the pool. Very nice diversion from an otherwise uneventful trip to this very average big city. This is a good choice for kids if they like to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Montreal”
Reviews.Author: midge1977
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some girlfriends for a weekend getaway. The hotel was very busy with a conference, so we didn't get our room preference. We were stuck with a smoking room on the bottom floor of the hotel. However, despite that I thought this Hilton was a great value for the room amenities and location. The room was very clean, and beautiful decor. The pillows and duvet were out of this world....but I expect this from every Hilton I stay at. It is quite a walk to the downtown core of the city that we were interested in, but there is a Metro (subway) stop inside the hotel so that helped us get around. The pool looked absolutely beautiful, but we didn't get a chance to take a swim. Staff was very helpful and friendly. I would consider it again for our next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Need urgent refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: jysh55
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient to the city centre and the staff quite helpful. Our room, a superior double, was OK but really the whole place could do with some new wallpaper and carpets! It's comfortable but not the 4* it purports to be and therefore not good value.

Reviews.Title: “City hotel with rooftop pool and garden”
Reviews.Author: Belgiantravellover
Reviews.Content: hotel in central downtown location. Comfortable, the greatest asset is the garden with swimming pool on the top floor is even heated in winter ! Book a room on the executive floor and enjoy complimentary breakfast and evening appetizers and snacks for a small fee. A perfect hotel to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, hotel a little dated, staff was incredibly attentive and nice”
Reviews.Author: David2468
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Hilton Bonaventure. It was our second stay there and we were very pleased. Some of the appointments in the hotel were a bit dated and there were occassional plumbing problems (the water shut off in the shower on two separate occasions before restarting 15-20 seconds later), yet our overall impressions were very positive. Our room was large and spacious. The breakfast buffet was ample with good service. The concierge staff was incredibly attentive and helpful and the hotel's location was excellent. The hotel also has one of the outdoor swimming pools in the area which we appreciated. I would certainly recommend this hotel although I hope the hotel attends to the water issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good but would look at other properties before next visit”
Reviews.Author: marymb
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for 3 nights. As stated in previous reviews, the hotel is composed of much concrete. Feels cave like in areas and takes getting used to. The rooms are very well appointed- great beds, pillows and toiletries, very clean Concierge lounge is very small, no views, but has excellent breakfast foods and nice appetizers in the evening and very good service. The hotel was rather quiet when we visited so the size of the lounge was adequate but I imagine if the hotel is full, the size would be a huge problem. The pool area is nice but that too is small and loungers are hard to come by and very uncomfortable. Location is close to underground access to shops, train. Easy on and off access to highway.

Reviews.Title: “Strange place”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerMA
Reviews.Content: Negative: The outside appearance of this hotel is frightening. When first encountering this monster of a building (that houses the Hilton on the top floor(s)) some of my initial thoughts were â€œOh my godâ€�, FÃ¼hrerbunker, Darth Vader. Do not stay here if you like hotels with character.. Annoyance: Concierge did not tell the truth about Gray Line Double Decker Montreal Bus Tours. She sold us a CAN$14 tour â€œdown paymentâ€� instead of telling us to just walk over to the tour operator a few blocks away. Gray Line Bus does NOT stop at Hilton Bonaventure. Tourist will be picked up by some bus and driven around town to pick up additional tourist.. By the time this had been completed familyâ€™s desire for bus tour had almost vanished..Even better, do not take the Gray Line Bus Tour at all since it is not worth the money (CAN$35 for adults). Positive: Mostly friendly, helpful staff Nice rooftop pool for city hotel Clean, reasonably spacious rooms Excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheOneWhoLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the top of a conference center/shops building with side entrance through the gates. It has an interesting garden with a pond, river, and waterfall. The rooms are spacious and yes you may need to carry your luggage over stairs unless you find the stairs with roller boards placed over them. The front desk informed me that they were working on placing them over every stair. In the mean time, you can use a service elevator, which is located to the left from you when you look toward corridor to the lobby once you are on the check in floor. The concierge and some attendants at the Club Lounge were helpful and knowledgeable. The food at the Club was one of the best, but the Club was often crowded. As for the location, it is great - you are within walking distance from old town, the port, the shops, and right across the main train station. In addition, the hotel is part of the Underground City connection, which is probably helpful during cold and windy winter months. I like the hotel and look forward returning there.

Reviews.Title: “penthouse living”
Reviews.Author: frippy28
Reviews.Content: hotel is penthouse in business section. unique gardens with waterfalls, plants, koi and vegetables. excellent breakfast buffets. dinner only in lounge bar area . parking is convenient and easy. public transp is easy once you get the hang of it. hot and humid weather made public transport stifling-no AC, system is not handicap friendly. conceirge outstanding. great swimming pool is negated by non guest access and "cinq to sept " eves.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and confortable with good location”
Reviews.Author: Crabou
Reviews.Content: I had 3 days to visit Montreal and this hotel was really a good spot. It is located in center, close to subway, within walking distance of movie theater, shops,... Hotel is very spacious and rooms are very well appointed. There a fitness center and even an (heated) outdoor pool that is open all year : swimming in the middle of a snow covered garden with chrismas lights is really an experience ! There is a shuttle bus that leave one block away that directly serves Montreal Trudeau airport.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: PhineusFlog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Bonaventure over Grand Prix weekend in June. The service and cleanliness is what you'd expect from a Hilton but there is an overall feeling of concrete caverns and darkness. The hotel itself is several stories up in a large concrete office block. You don't exactly walk in the front door to the lobby; you walk in, take an elevator up several floors and then get deposited into an entrance area for the lobby. Hilton has done a good job in masking it with a couple gardens and outdoor pool, but if you're coming and going you always have to wait for an elevator. The rooms are OK, they were clean and cleaned, the breakfast good, as you'd expect in Montreal. The hotel is convenient to get to from out of town and the train station is directly adjacent, however it's not terribly near any Metro stops and a decent walk to any restaurants, and the Crescent St, St Catherine's area. I didn't pay for my stay, but if I were I'd search for more convenient places for the money. There is nothing wrong with the place, just not quite convenient enough for the money you'd pay. Parking is in an underground garage which is pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of country in the city!”
Reviews.Author: irondoc
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Montreal for a conference which was held at this hotel. I really enjoyed staying here. My girlfriend and I stayed for 4 nights. The hotel is a little unusual, located on the top floors of the Bonaventure bldg, so you go up the elevator almost to the top floor to get to the lobby. There are some beautifully landscaped gardens, a pond with ducks and trees all on the top story of a downtown building! There are wonderful little shaded places to eat overlooking this bit of natural world. The hotel staff were accommodating and friendly and welcomed us and our dog (animal friendly!!). The room was very quiet and comfortable. The bed was sumptuous with great pillows. I had lunch meals at the conference which were catered by the Hilton and they were excellent!! The only down side is that it is located more in the business center of town, rather than the more touristy old town section, but as long as you don't mind walking this area was easily accessed, but was about a mile - 1.5 mile walk. The walk and city seemed very safe. We also walked to a wonderful park - Mt Royal and a great jazz dinner club as well. The outdoor pool was also very nice. Parking was a bit expensive, but I expect this is par for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great decor - Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Anikabella
Reviews.Content: This hotel had one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept it. The room was large enough for us 4 girls. Everything was very nice. Very clean. The front desk was great and efficient. The Concierge was also very helpful. The guys at the front of the hotel were very nice as well. The location is excellent. Situated right in front of the VIArail station and all the underground tunnels in downtown Montreal. I have nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Chillinathtown
Reviews.Content: Great and helpful staff. The hotel could use some remodeling. Walking into the rooms was like a retro decor.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at the Bonaventure Hilton for many years, was curious to see if the property was fresh and updated - and unfortunately was very disappointed. What was once a fairly modern even elegant hotel with unique architecture has slipped a few notches in my opinion. I would not put it in the same category as the other four star properties in Montreal and would not recommend the hotel. The rooms were just ok, fairly basic Hilton rooms. I didn't care for the hallways or the public areas, which were swarming with conventioneers. I have stayed at most of the other four star hotels in Montreal, and would put this hotel at the bottom of the list, perhaps not even on the list. This is really a 3.5 star property. Wouldn't return anytime soon unless the rate was really attractive. Also hated the nickel and dime charges - business center use was expensive, sending a fax cost me in excess of $20 - one gets the feeling each of these amenities are profit centers, not guest services.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Do NOT stay here...you've been warned.”
Reviews.Author: Pakse
Reviews.Content: I am not kidding, this hotel is wonderful. The staff were friendly, positive and welcoming. Excellent service - helpful and kind without be overbearing or annoying. This is hard to do well. Great staff. The Executive lounge staff - perfect - best lounge staff ever. The pool? They aren't kidding - it's very, very warm - great for an outdoor swim in any weather. And it's big enough for a real swim. Loved my room - well appointed. You should not stay here. I was running late the morning I was checking out - hotel staff had no problem with me checking out 20 minutes late. So I went to take a quick shower before I left. NO HOT WATER. I call the desk.... Me: There's no hot water. Hotel: That happens Sir, there will be hot water eventually. Me: When? Hotel: I don't know Sir. I couldn't wait forever - I had a meeting to get to....waited the 30 minutes I had...then I had to leave. Walking out I stopped at the front desk and was told: "It's an old hotel Sir, there is no hot water sometimes" No offer to adjust the bill for my inconvience....nothing...just "It happens"... Don't stay here. Sometimes there's no hot water. And when there is no hot water - no one seems to care at all. Other than that - this hotel is perfect - I loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel - very comfortable and great service.”
Reviews.Author: eminbk
Reviews.Content: Room was spotless and housekeeping kept it clean and tidy; supercomfy king bed with 5 featherpillows plus heavy curtains made for great sleeping. The floor lamp was broken and the clock/radio was kind of low-end, but those are minor details. Internet was serviceable at $10/day. Room service in particular was astonishingly prompt and pleasant and the food (2 breakfasts, one soup & salad dinner) was delicious. Every staff member I dealt with over 3 days was helpful, smiling, and pleasant, from the concierge to the workman repairing a bit of ripped wallpaper in the hallway. I liked the atmosphere. There is a 1970s decor scheme, but I enjoyed that as a style -- the building was constructed back then and has a 70s architectural design. I am glad that the decor reflects this. There does seem to be ongoing restoration work to keep things nice. My only problem was that the "print your document from your room" feature didn't work for me. When I asked for help at the front desk, there was only one computer station that could access my document and it was in use by a staffperson who spent ages with another guest. It seemed like that guest was splitting her bill over 10 different credit cards or something complicated. I waited for ten minutes but they were still deep in negotiations and no one else could help me, so I had to go to my meeting without my documents. It wasn't the end of the world, but a business hotel should have more ways to print a document than one computer terminal that is also used for billing. And they should have a staff person in the business center to assist people with technology troubles. But overall I enjoyed my stay. I had a conference rate under $200/night rather than the rack rate so it was affordable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: retraite10
Reviews.Content: From the Valet to the reception and the Belbedere bar, everything was excellent. We could not ask for better. The staff make you feel at home . The beds are really good. Th Hotel is extremely well located, they have a fantastic heated pool and the food is excellent! We had a terrific weekend! Lorraine

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: JeffkVancouver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful however in dire need of updating. The service is nice however the lobby is stuffy, the lounge is less than inviting. There are currently renovations ongoing.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Pleasure stay in Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: Karthik79
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which lets you mix business and pleasure without any hassles... bang in the middle of the city, bordering the old Montreal and new side of Montreal... this is a heaven for business travellers who want to let their hair loose in the evenings / weekends... with wonderful views of the new city on one side and the amazing views of old Montreal's cultural heritage on the other side, one couldn't ask for more from a hotel stay... Close to all the central attractions in the city and to the old Montreal for the cultural heritage sites, this place is convenient for both business and pleasure. A plush pool on the roof top, with a man made stream running on the terrace, with trees surrounding the parapet walls on the terrace, this hotel makes you feel like you are in the ground level, even while on the terrace... amazing room service, ever friendly customer reps, multiple ATM facilities, wonderful restaurant with wide options, they even have a gift shop in the hotel... the main train station is across the road from the hotel. Travel to Montreal in the first week of July ensures you get to be a part of the International Jazz festival, celebrated to commemorate the Canada Day, every year... This festival happens minutes walk away from the hotel and is a definite must-watch event... with over 15-20 stages set all over the business district, and fireworks happening every night across the old port, Old Montreal... this stay was the most pleasant one that I've had in a long long time....

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bluesmoon
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Bonaventure is located in the heart of Montreal. It's just a block away from Rue Ste. Katharine and sitting atop the Bonaventure subway station. For the most part this is a very good hotel. The rooms are great, staff are friendly and helpful and they have a heated outdoor pool open from 6:30am to 10:30pm year round. It's fun to swim outdoors when there's snow all around you. The restaurants are good but a little overpriced and internet in the rooms costs $9.50 a day but isn't very fast. You can get free wifi in the lobby area though, which is far better. It's easy to get around Montreal from this hotel. Rue Ste. Katharine has several restaurants, bars and shopping areas and it's a short ride on the subway to Mont Royal for more downtown fun. Vieux Montreal is also reachable via the subway from this stop. Parking is expensive though, at $26 per day, so you're best off taking public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge”
Reviews.Author: sjkel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in 3 hotels in Montreal so far and by far this hotel has the best concierge. They were at the desk more than any other place and knew more than any other place. The location was great- situated right by a metro and right inbetween downtown and Old Montreal. The hotel is all penthouse, so all the rooms are on the top floor- great views. The rooms are updated and have just about everything. Anytime I needed anything, the staff was very responsive and friendly. The only negative I have is that the pool is outside and there is NO HOT TUB! That was such a bummer! I would never stay here in winter because our top priority is a pool and if there is an outdoor pool, there better be a hot tub, esp. in winter! Even summer nights can get chilly and I wished there was one. However the pool itself is nicely kept and a good size with lots of chairs. We enjoyed that we could order movies. Over all a good experience. I'd stay here again in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: mimikaayu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. Overall bad experience. When I first arrived, I realized the hotel has no elevator, that means I have to drag my luggage up 3 floors to my room. Secondly, the entire hotel is very old, the corridor are hideous, the rooms are old. It's just totally uncomfortable and unwelcoming. Lastly when I tried to connect to the internet (which is included in my business plan), it did not work! I called up front desk to transferred me to tech support which put me on hold for ages and ended up not solving the problem. Internet is basic for anyone staying for business. There are many hotels better with similar price in Montreal. I would definitely not go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Just Alittle Bit Expensive”
Reviews.Author: joshodi
Reviews.Content: Great Location, not as dated as other reviewers stated, pleasant staff, no free internet services in the rooms except for the lobby. For the room price of this hotel, internet should be free in the room. Breakfast and dinner were great..and I did make good friends at the lobby...a jolly good place!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Much nicer hotels for a lot less money”
Reviews.Author: jdealman
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton diehard, so I stay predominately at Hilton for the points and free breakfasts which my gold status affords me. I recently went to Montreal and stayed at 3 seperate Hilton properties: Embassy suites, Hilton Garden Inn Centerville, and the Hilton bonaventure. Of the three the Embassy suites had best room. The Garden Inn best location and overall value. The Bonaventure was the most expensive and most outdated and worst location. The rooms had supposedly been revamped in 2009. I don't know what that means! Just because it has a flat screen tv is it revamped??? This hotel is so dated from the 60's/70's! The bathrooms clearly show the age. I noted rates for the high $100's to low $200's. WhAt a joke! I paid a travel industry rate of $133, and that was over priced! The room was more like a Motel 6 than a Hilton. They did have a nice breakfast buffett, if you could get an attentant to serve you. Save your money and stay at the garden inn with free wifi in your room and free local calls and great crossiants for around $120/night(better locAtion too).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mimi0137
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when we visited Montreal and it had a great location, we were able to get every place we wanted to go very easily, I would recommend the service was not the best, but the bell boys were great with the family.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Stacypay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is recently remodled with lovely high class touches. The room is comfortable with large beds and a nice flat screen. It is a tri level floor plan without elevators so if you have a lot of luggage arrival can be tricky. The heated outdoor pool is very nice and the location of the hotel is excellent- just a short walk to either Old Montreal or shopping on Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, odd layout”
Reviews.Author: FDanvers
Reviews.Content: Friendly and professional service at check in and check out. Rooms were clean and well serviced, but public areas were not always clean (what looked like an Aleve tablet lay on stairs outside my bedroom for 2 days and was clearly visible on the dark carpet; dirty plates left outside a room down the corridor from early morning till midnight; lint on many stairs and hallways). Idiosyncratic layout of hotel with many stairs to go up and down before reaching a room made me wonder how guests who have difficulty in walking cope. On my last evening a loud mechanical noise started close to my room. A hotel staff member came to my room, could not locate the noise but promised to call back minutes later and to move me to another room. He never returned and reception did not know who the staff member in question was. Was there for a business meeting and can commend staff in charge of meeting rooms, audiovisual equipment, etc. for being efficient, knowledgeable, polite and very professional. Lunch and drinks catering also went effortlessly and right on time. Overall okay. Beds very comfy (for me the most important aspect of any hotel) and bed linen impeccably clean. Would be nice to have wi-fi in the room (free wi-fi in lobby painfully slow). Given the price I would advise going to the Delta one block away if the room is used only for sleeping and save C$60-70 per night in the process.

Reviews.Title: “A little austere in public areas, but some nice features”
Reviews.Author: chp37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Bonaventure the last week of October. Unfortunately, my room had no heat. They gave me some space heaters as the hotel was sold out which made the room warm enough although they once flipped the circuit breaker. I think that they could have done more to compensate, though in that I stayed 5 days and they gave me 20% off of 2 days, which I think was a bit cheap of them. It has a nice gym and the executive lounge breakfast was well stocked as well as the attendant was extremely helpful making me a latte every morning. Good selection of appetizers in the evening, but unlike many executive lounges, the alcoholic beverages were not free. Although I would have liked to try it, it has a year round outdoor heated swimming pool and I think that is a big draw for this hotel. It also is built as the penthouse in a large office building and the rooftop is done as a nice garden with paths plants and trees. It makes for a nice oasis even though you are in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: RRT
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat staying at this hotel for its location and roof top oasis. The rooms have been updated (been coming here since 2000). Perfect location for Montreal. Great for both site seeing during the day and night life. Everything is walkable. The rooms are large and clean. The rooftop pool is amazing (lots of fun in the winter when it is snowing on you while swimming in a 80 degree pool). Only downside is the outrageous drink prices at the poo bar. Besides that, we loved this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great renovations”
Reviews.Author: Platonic
Reviews.Content: Wow! The Hilton Montreal has made great renovations since my last stay in 2007!!!!! The spectacular rooftop garden is always the main attraction of this architectural Icon from the sixties. I liked the new rooms and Lobby,

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: EndlessItinerary
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in boutique hotels and this one had that feel without the high price tag. This unique hotel set on the roof of Place Bonaventure is quite a deal. We paid US$100 through Priceline and would have paid more. The room and bathroom were comfy, roomy, clean and well appointed. We had a view into the unique rooftop garden. Where else can you find a rooftop koi pond with ducks?! We also took a dip in the heated rooftop pool. Plus, the concierge was always helpful. You can take the elevator down to the Bonaventure Station to access stores, restaurants and the metro station. It's also a quick walk to Old Montreal and St. Catherine Street. Can't think of any complaints. Sure, the pool was sometimes crowded and there were occasionally kids running through the halls, but it was early July in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DavidBelgium
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, furniture and bathroom a bit dated. A pity that the hotel restaurant isn't open in the evening. The bar is nice but very crowded. The overall feel in the hotel is that it 's dated, you don't get a luxurious feel. Although staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: MrsHarris
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Bonaventure because colleagues had chosen it for a conference. The rooms were fine, clean, adequately appointed. Neither the shaving mirror nor the bathroom audio worked. First $12 condoms I've ever seen in the minibar. The layout is bizarre, and since I had supplemental oxygen, toting the tank up and down the twelve steps to my room was laborious, and mine was one of the "handicapped accessible" rooms. Ha! My colleague in a wheelchair was taken to her room by service elevator every time she came from her room for a meeting, shopping or a meal. The underground shopping area was generous, but again, took literally scores of steps up and down to access some of the areas. What would it take to put a wheel ramp in? The lunches catered in-house were dreadful. Spaghetti and frozen meatballs with pumpkin soup on Monday, Pumpkin soup with spaghetti and curry on Tuesday, cold spaghetti with Thai dressing on Thursday... you get the picture. The service was magnificent. The staff was professional, helpful, cheerful and made up for many of the facilities' shortcomings. Depending upon what your goals are, this could be a great stay or a great disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant staff, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: vincentinparis
Reviews.Content: The location is great for business and is close to the trendy galeries like the Fonderie Darling, the activities on Place des Arts, Chinatown and the quaint streets of Old Montreal. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable, from the lifeguard to the concierge to housekeeping to reception, where I saw a manager efficiently assist a couple who'd left a passport in their previous hotel before joking with me about our shared first name. Housekeeping was also very good about locating and returning something I'd left in the room after I checked out. The gym was adequate, the pool looked nice, though its position outside the reception windows was a bit odd. In fact, the layout of the hotel spread out pretty much in a single layer the length of a city block is a little labyrinthine, with a fair amount of walking to get from one place to the other. In its architecture (concrete and glassed-in green terraces) is very much a reflection of a lot of Montreal's boom between Expo 67 and the Olympics in 76, giving it a slightly dated feel, rather than the Austin Powers cool it might have once had. My standard room was a decent size. Again, no bells or whistles, just staightforward, clean, and sufficient. For my taste, I'd pick something with a little more personality, but it's a chain and for the convenience of a chain it was absolutely fine. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pretty hotel property and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: TX-DCgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the center of downtown Montreal just across the street from a Metro station and within walking distance of the Art museum, shopping on St. Catherine street and Old Town Montreal. The hotel property is surrounded by gardens, water features, and offers a great pool and well equipped gym so it feels almost like a resort in the middle of the city. The concierge offered many good suggestions of moderately priced restaurants in the area that we wouldn't have found without his suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton made a difference with our stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: MississaugaGirl1234
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at the Hilton! It was our first time visiting Montreal and the Front Desk (can't remember his name) and the Concierge (Roberto) was friendly, helpful and made a difference with our stay. They made reservations for us , and printed directions to Quebec City for the day. Room Service was fast and not as outrageous as I thought it would be. Some times you can hear people opening and closing their doors in the hall way, but that is the extent of the noise. It didn't realy bother us since we were tired and had no problems sleeping. Our hotel rooms were clean, spacious and newly renovated. The shower head was nice and strong and the beds were super comfortable. It was a very pleasant and enjoyable stay. There was an outdoor heated pool and the life gaurd was kinda cute to look at. ;D In the morning, there is a timmy's across the street, along with a Mcdonalds, and food court from the VIA rail station. The Hilton is in the heart of downtown Montreal, within walking distance of St. Catherines and Centre street...although it's better to take a $8 taxi ride to centre street if you're in heels. =) I would recommend and stay at the hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Montreal stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelmaven1
Reviews.Content: Loved the serenity of the roof top garden. It was lush with foliage and had some seating arrangements along the walk. The large size pool and pool area were lovely. The room was very nice, spacious, newly furnished. The tapas bar and restaurant was very good and was opened until 11:30 Saturday night. Apparently the new chef was from Portugal. The hotel is conveniently located. Its downtown and across the street from the Amtrak station.Buffet breakfast was done nicely, good pastries, etc. Small sets of stairs without ramps between various levels of the hotel could be a problem for some people. We would gladly stay here again. .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelVT
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Montreal Bonaventure is a great location in the downtown with quick acceess to the Metro. While the rooms are a bit dated, the property in interesting and clean. The pool is amazing! The concierge was quite knowledgeable and helped us find a great brew pub (Dieu du Ciel), as well as several wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't like noises, don't come to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: q_qfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights this past weekend. We were first given a room right by the staircase, so we went and exchanged for another room which again was near another staircase. Lots of noises of people talking on their cell phone late at night and cleaning ladies chatting loud during the day. We just gave up on exchanging for rooms figuring it is probably the same everywhere. We found 2 spiders in our room. There was a spider web in the bathroom. The bed was a bit too soft for our taste and will not work for anyone with back problems. The location is ok. It's right in the downtown financial district. The neighbourhood was pretty dead when we were there. But for the price we paid, it is not bad. We will not go back to this hotel however.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from Arrival to Departure”
Reviews.Author: hospitalityexecutive
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a luxurious 1 bedroom suite with living room and piano! Can't beat the value for entertaining our friends while in the Montreal area. Staff were friendly and efficient, and very accommodating. Being a hotel manager myself, I tend to be very critical. I found the room to be very clean and well maintained. A great big THANK YOU to the managment for the upgrade, I will definately recommend your hotel to my collegues.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: wextech
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights via Priceline and were really pleased. We had a problem with our first room in that it was either near an elevator shaft or pipes and there was a hum that would wake us up. After stating our problem we were moved to a different room and they comp'd our parking. Yes, the layout is a little strange, but certainly not offputting. The room was very large and nicely furnished, and the reception area, pool, gym, and bar were first rate. We were short walking distance from both downtown and the old city. All of the hotel staff with whom we interacted where courteous and knowledgeable. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: JUdyrem
Reviews.Content: First of all,they gave us THE worst room in the place when we checked in, right by the elevator shaft! Immediately went to reception and complained, got a quieter room. The place is a maize, hard to navigate. If you have mobility problems, don't stay here. The room only had 2 glasses. What gives with that? Business center computer is expensive and SLOW. We also were HHonors members, and they did not give us a paper. Staff was a just a bit pretentious IMO. I would rather have stayed in "old" Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable! But a few problems...”
Reviews.Author: BradfordwoodsTrekker
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during the International Jazz Festival. First the good: The beds are extraordinarily comfortable! I did not want to get out of them. The rooms are nicely decorated and modern, as is the foyer & hotel lobby. We truly enjoyed the rooftop pool, which was a warm comfortable temperature, after a long day of sightseeing. I liked having the elevator take us up and away from the activity down below into the quiet lobby of the hotel. The metro is conveniently located below the building (but a long long walk). Now the problems: signage was the first. We had difficulty finding the hotel, even with the address & map, because the sign is on the side of the building. The driveway is easy to miss because there are no signs. Frustrating when you are driving in from out of town during rush hour. When we checked in, we were told we had our choice of the following rooms: a room with 2 double beds, or a room with a queen bed. Upon further inquiry about the queen, we discovered it was actually a queen pull-out sofa located in a suite, where the hotel had already rented the bedroom portion of the suite to someone else!! (I will note here that we did book the room at a very low rate on priceline.com...but that is no excuse for offering a pull-out sofa and calling it a bed!) We chose the double beds, and were very satisfied. Another problem: our room had a grassy weedy area outside the window with junk laying around, mostly what appeared to be unused electrical fixtures. Very ugly and made the view look like something out of a cheap motel (I am posting a picture.) In addition, there was a hallway door that opened out onto the junky area, which allowed anyone who opened it to stand right outside our window, even though we were on the 12th floor! I was actually standing next to the window wearing next to nothing when the door opened, and I quickly drew the curtains, leaving our room in darkness. Since our visit coincided with the jazz festival, a major event in Montreal, we asked the concierge about getting tickets to a particular concert. He looked at the event calendar, then said the event was invitation only so we couldn't go. Not very helpful. Later as we walked around the city, we entered the Hyatt and asked their concierge about the same concert. Even though we said we were not guests at the Hyatt, the concierge was very friendly, made a few calls, drew us a map and showed us exactly where to go. All we had to do was go to the venue of the concert and buy tickets. The Hilton concierge should have been able to figure that out. (The Hyatt concierge also recommended a fabulous restaurant (Restaurant Julien....great food, great service!)). And finally, although the hotel lobby and rooms were elegant and comfortable, the hallways had carpeting that looked 30 years old, was fraying and threadbare in places. Even with these problems, we would stay here again if we got a good rate. I would not pay more than $200/night for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect, practically in the clouds, serene and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: WeLikeTravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is the top two stories of a block-sized downtown office building with a private elevator, with a convention space directly beneath. Lobby's in the middle, rooms are split-level around the perimeter with four courtyards. Two patio bar/restaurants between the rooms and lobby form two courtyards, a spectacular outdoor pool in the third courtyard, and a serene rooftop garden in the fourth. Gardens are plentiful, this is truly a unique space of peace in a busy city. Enter 900 Rue De la GauchetiÃ¨re Ouest, Montreal, QC, Canada in Google Earth and you'll see the driveway entrance, pool and gardens for yourself. Garage is underground. Waterfalls and fountains are everywhere (even in the pool, which is open year-round with a small indoor entry). Pool was very comfortably warm and did not smell of chlorine, surrounded by lilies, flowers and mature trees. Study any fire exit graphic and you'll quickly get the layout. Yes, you must go up or down a 1/2 flight of very shallow stairs to get to any room, so baby strollers could be a challenge. If you go anywhere in Montreal, you'll climb many stairs and do a lot of walking. Let the porter handle your luggage. Prices in Montreal are high for everything a tourist would want. There are cheap places the locals go to eat, but don't bother unless you're on a tight budget. Or go to Beijing in Chinatown for a very good, affordable meal. Get restaurant recommendations from Chantal at the Concierge desk - she never steered us wrong. Gibby's in Old Montreal, Vertige, nearly everything we ate was really fabulous, with presentation and service (and prices) beyond compare. But avoid Cora's (6-block walk) for breakfast unless you want a dull, comparatively inexpensive but impressive looking meal. I found that the $10/day fee for in-room wired or wireless Internet access generated more than quite a few very casually-dressed folks in the lobby area (which has unlimited free wi-fi). I tried every trick I know to get a free signal in my room; no luck. This may be de rigeur for Montreal, but it looks ridiculous to business travellers (who made a few comments about it in the lobby). Every hotel in any town has free in-room wi-fi, but not this one. I hope they fix this issue. Staff was very courteous and professional, very stylishly dressed, bilingual. Room was completely quiet unless you get a crying baby in the adjoining room. Self-parking was $17/day but no in & out. If you want to use your car, it's $25/day for valet parking to come and go as you like. This is not uncommon for downtown hotels. Bed was very comfortable, with a comforter between two sheets -- very nice. Bring your own pillow if you can -- these are pretty tall. Room was nice, roomy, clean, well-appointed. Nice closet, dresser, TV, electric outlets, bathroom. Every room has a view of a courtyard or the skyline. Mini-bar means there's no refrigerator for you to use. Roomy desk/work area with a nice office chair. Minor maintenance issues, but that seems to be pretty normal for hotels -- you need to tell someone if you want stuff fixed. Fitness center with the usual machines is huge and unused, additional room with yoga mats & pilates, lockers, more. About 6 block walk to Chinatown, 9 blocks to Old Montreal. Metro subway station in the basement, so you could get anywhere in town without a car (subway trains coordinate with bus routes). Train station across the street for out of town travel.
